name: Bulbasaur
dexEntry: While it is young, it uses the nutrients that are stored in the seed on its back in order to grow.

name: Ivysaur
dexEntry: Exposure to sunlight adds to its strength. Sunlight also makes the bud on its back grow larger.

name: Venusaur
dexEntry: A bewitching aroma wafts from its flower. The fragrance becalms those engaged in a battle.

name: Charmander
dexEntry: From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to go out.

name: Charmeleon
dexEntry: If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts intense flames, incinerating its surroundings.

name: Charizard
dexEntry: Its wings can carry this Pokémon close to an altitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out fire at very high temperatures.

name: Squirtle
dexEntry: When it feels threatened, it draws its limbs inside its shell and sprays water from its mouth.

name: Wartortle
dexEntry: It cleverly controls its furry ears and tail to maintain its balance while swimming.

name: Blastoise
dexEntry: The rocket cannons on its shell fire jets of water capable of punching holes through thick steel.

name: Caterpie
dexEntry: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls.

name: Metapod
dexEntry: Even though it is encased in a sturdy shell, the body inside is tender. It can’t withstand a harsh attack.

name: Butterfree
dexEntry: It collects honey every day. It rubs honey onto the hairs on its legs to carry it back to its nest.

name: Weedle
dexEntry: Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.

name: Kakuna
dexEntry: Able to move only slightly. When endangered, it may stick out its stinger and poison its enemy.

name: Beedrill
dexEntry: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.

name: Pidgey
dexEntry: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.

name: Pidgeotto
dexEntry: This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.

name: Pidgeot
dexEntry: This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.

name: Rattata
dexEntry: Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you see one, you can be certain that 40 more live in the area.

name: Raticate
dexEntry: Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.

name: Spearow
dexEntry: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.

name: Fearow
dexEntry: A Pokémon that dates back many years. If it senses danger, it flies high and away, instantly.

name: Ekans
dexEntry: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.

name: Arbok
dexEntry: The frightening patterns on its belly have been studied. Six variations have been confirmed.

name: Pikachu
dexEntry: Possesses cheek sacs in which it stores electricity. This clever forest-dweller roasts tough berries with an electric shock before consuming them.

name: Raichu
dexEntry: It can discharge bursts of electricity exceeding 100,000 volts— a single strike with that amount of power would incapacitate one of the Copperajah of my homeland.

name: Sandshrew
dexEntry: It burrows into the ground to create its nest. If hard stones impede its tunneling, it uses its sharp claws to shatter them and then carries on digging.

name: Sandslash
dexEntry: It climbs trees by hooking on with its sharp claws. Sandslash shares the berries it gathers, dropping them down to Sandshrew waiting below the tree.

name: Nidoran-f
dexEntry: It uses its hard incisor teeth to crush and eat berries. The tip of a female Nidoran’s horn is a bit more rounded than the tip of a male’s horn.

name: Nidorina
dexEntry: If the group is threatened, these Pokémon will band together to assault enemies with a chorus of ultrasonic waves.

name: Nidoqueen
dexEntry: It pacifies offspring by placing them in the gaps between the spines on its back. The spines will never secrete poison while young are present.

name: Nidoran-m
dexEntry: Small but brave, this Pokémon will hold its ground and even risk its life in battle to protect the female it’s friendly with.

name: Nidorino
dexEntry: It’s nervous and quick to act aggressively. The potency of its poison increases along with the level of adrenaline present in its body.

name: Nidoking
dexEntry: Nidoking prides itself on its strength. It’s forceful and spirited in battle, making use of its thick tail and diamond-crushing horn.

name: Clefairy
dexEntry: It can be found in quiet mountain areas on a full moon's night. Its dancing and its tiny, faintly glowing wings confer upon it a lovely fairylike quality.

name: Clefable
dexEntry: Legend says that on clear, quiet nights, it listens for the voices of its kin living on the moon. I, too, often think of my homeland, so far away.

name: Vulpix
dexEntry: In its belly burns a fire, which Vulpix spits out in the form of fireballs. When young, this Pokémon has but one white tail. As the Pokémon matures, this single tail splits into six.

name: Ninetales
dexEntry: The coat of gleaming golden fur is quite magnificent. This species is said to store sacred power in its nine long tails and to live for a millennium.

name: Jigglypuff
dexEntry: By freely changing the wavelength of its voice, Jigglypuff sings a mysterious melody sure to make any listener sleepy.

name: Wigglytuff
dexEntry: It’s proud of its fur, which is fine and delicate. In particular, the curl on its forehead has a texture that’s perfectly heavenly.

name: Zubat
dexEntry: Makes its home in gloomy caves. Atrophied eyes have left this Pokémon blind, so it scans its surroundings via sound waves that it emits from its mouth as it flies.

name: Golbat
dexEntry: It sinks its sharp fangs into other creatures and slurps up their blood. A closer look at the fangs reveals that they are hollow and akin to straws.

name: Oddish
dexEntry: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.

name: Gloom
dexEntry: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

name: Vileplume
dexEntry: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.

name: Paras
dexEntry: Sometimes seen at the foot of trees in humid forests. The mushrooms on its back—called tochukaso—are not present on infant specimens and instead emerge as Paras matures.

name: Parasect
dexEntry: Mushroom-lacking specimens of this Pokémon lie unmoving in the forest, lending credence to the hypothesis that the large mushroom is in control of Parasect's actions.

name: Venonat
dexEntry: Its large eyes act as radar. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.

name: Venomoth
dexEntry: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove from skin. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.

name: Diglett
dexEntry: It burrows through the ground at a shallow depth. It leaves raised earth in its wake, making it easy to spot.

name: Dugtrio
dexEntry: These Diglett triplets dig over 60 miles below sea level. No one knows what it’s like underground.

name: Meowth
dexEntry: It loves to collect shiny things. If it’s in a good mood, it might even let its Trainer have a look at its hoard of treasures.

name: Persian
dexEntry: Its elegant and refined behavior clashes with that of the barbaric Perrserker. The relationship between the two is one of mutual disdain.

name: Psyduck
dexEntry: Suffers perpetual headaches. If the agony grows too great, Psyduck's latent power erupts, contrary to Psyduck's intent. Ergo, I am exploring ways to ease the pain.

name: Golduck
dexEntry: Its body is strong, and it has webbing on its hands and feet. Golduck can swim easily through rough seas, clawing its way through the high waves.

name: Mankey
dexEntry: An agile Pokémon that lives in trees. It angers easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.

name: Primeape
dexEntry: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.

name: Growlithe
dexEntry: They patrol their territory in pairs. I believe the igneous rock components in the fur of this species are the result of volcanic activity in its habitat.

name: Arcanine
dexEntry: Snaps at its foes with fangs cloaked in blazing flame. Despite its bulk, it deftly feints every which way, leading opponents on a deceptively merry chase as it all but dances around them.

name: Poliwag
dexEntry: In rivers with fast-flowing water, this Pokémon will cling to a rock by using its thick lips, which act like a suction cup.

name: Poliwhirl
dexEntry: This Pokémon’s sweat is a slimy mucus. When captured, Poliwhirl can slither from its enemies’ grasp and escape.

name: Poliwrath
dexEntry: Poliwrath is skilled at both swimming and martial arts. It uses its well-trained arms to dish out powerful punches.

name: Abra
dexEntry: Spends 18 hours of the day sleeping. Even while asleep, Abra can control its psychic powers—should danger approach, the Pokémon will simply teleport away.

name: Kadabra
dexEntry: There are rumors that a child with mystical powers became a Kadabra; however, this remains unverified. I suspect that the spoon Kadabra holds enhances its brain waves.

name: Alakazam
dexEntry: The longer Alakazam lives, the larger and heavier its head becomes. Our tests have shown that the strength of its psychic powers correlates positively to the weight of its head.

name: Machop
dexEntry: Though as small as a child, it has strength enough to easily throw a well-built adult. Striving to become ever stronger, Machop trains by carrying a Graveler on its shoulders.

name: Machoke
dexEntry: A sturdy creature boasting a robust physique and boundless stamina. Loves training above all else and voluntarily assists with tasks such as construction and clearing land.

name: Machamp
dexEntry: In close combat, its four arms afford it offensive and defensive supremacy. In but a blink, this valiant Pokémon can overwhelm its foes with more than 1,000 blows from its fists.

name: Bellsprout
dexEntry: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.

name: Weepinbell
dexEntry: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is dissolved by strong acids.

name: Victreebel
dexEntry: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.

name: Tentacool
dexEntry: They fire beams from the glassy, magenta orbs that resemble eyes atop their heads, and they drift in shallow seas. During low tide, they can sometimes be found on beaches, desiccated.

name: Tentacruel
dexEntry: It has 80 tentacles, each with a venomous tip. These tentacles are also extendible, lengthening when Tentacruel attempts to catch prey. Use caution.

name: Geodude
dexEntry: Makes its home in mountainous regions, using its arms to climb along harsh mountain roads. Can be troublesome—carelessly kicking one will cause it to fly into a rage and chase after you.

name: Graveler
dexEntry: Dwells in holes dug into sheer walls of stone. It enjoys rolling down slopes as though it were a boulder during a rockfall, so keep an eye upward while traversing mountain roads.

name: Golem
dexEntry: The rocklike shell is shed each year. The cast-off shell then crumbles, reverting to a mass of soil, which can be spread across fields to promote crop growth.

name: Ponyta
dexEntry: These Pokémon live in herds out in the grassland. Newborn foals lack their fiery manes, which will develop about an hour after birth.

name: Rapidash
dexEntry: Fiery mane aglow, Rapidash darts like an arrow across the land. This prodigiously swift creature can traverse the vast region of Hisui in a day and a half.

name: Slowpoke
dexEntry: When this Pokémon’s tail is soaked in water, sweetness seeps from it. Slowpoke uses this trait to lure in and fish up other Pokémon.

name: Slowbro
dexEntry: Being bitten by a Shellder shocked this Pokémon into standing on two legs. If the Shellder lets go, it seems Slowbro will turn back into a Slowpoke.

name: Magnemite
dexEntry: A bizarre Pokémon with but a single eye embedded in an iron sphere. I suspect this creature levitates due to the magnetism it emits from its arms, which resemble horseshoe-shaped magnets.

name: Magneton
dexEntry: Three Magnemite gathered to evolve into this Pokémon. The source of much vexation on my part, as its powerful magnetism destroys my research equipment.

name: Farfetchd
dexEntry: They use a plant stalk as a weapon, but not all of them use it in the same way. Several distinct styles of stalk fighting have been observed.

name: Doduo
dexEntry: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.

name: Dodrio
dexEntry: One of Doduo’s two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.

name: Seel
dexEntry: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Dewgong
dexEntry: Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.

name: Grimer
dexEntry: Made of congealed sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds won’t grow in its path.

name: Muk
dexEntry: Smells so awful, it can cause fainting. Through degeneration of its nose, it lost its sense of smell.

name: Shellder
dexEntry: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.

name: Cloyster
dexEntry: Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to open, even by those with superior strength.

name: Gastly
dexEntry: Gaseous and completely impalpable. Also highly dangerous— inhaling part of its poisonous body will cause one to faint instantly.

name: Haunter
dexEntry: This frightful, malevolent spirit can glide through walls, appearing wherever it likes. According to rumor, victims of a Haunter's lick will wither to death day by day.

name: Gengar
dexEntry: Possesses potential victims' shadows in an effort to steal away the victims' lives. If your shadow begins to laugh, you must take hold of a protective charm posthaste!

name: Onix
dexEntry: This chain of immense stones resembles a giant serpent. Tremors shake the earth above as it burrows deep beneath the ground, feeding on boulders as it goes.

name: Drowzee
dexEntry: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it had eaten in the past.

name: Hypno
dexEntry: Avoid eye contact if you come across one. It will try to put you to sleep by using its pendulum.

name: Krabby
dexEntry: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.

name: Kingler
dexEntry: Its oversized claw is very powerful, but when it’s not in battle, the claw just gets in the way.

name: Voltorb
dexEntry: An enigmatic Pokémon that happens to bear a resemblance to a Poké Ball. When excited, it discharges the electric current it has stored in its belly, then lets out a great, uproarious laugh.

name: Electrode
dexEntry: The tissue on the surface of its body is curiously similar in composition to an Apricorn. When irritated, this Pokémon lets loose an electric current equal to 20 lightning bolts.

name: Exeggcute
dexEntry: These Pokémon get nervous when they’re not in a group of six. The minute even one member of the group goes missing, Exeggcute become cowardly.

name: Exeggutor
dexEntry: When they work together, Exeggutor’s three heads can put out powerful psychic energy. Cloudy days make this Pokémon sluggish.

name: Cubone
dexEntry: This Pokémon wears the skull of its deceased mother. Sometimes Cubone’s dreams make it cry, but each tear Cubone sheds makes it stronger.

name: Marowak
dexEntry: When this Pokémon evolved, the skull of its mother fused to it. Marowak’s temperament also turned vicious at the same time.

name: Hitmonlee
dexEntry: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.

name: Hitmonchan
dexEntry: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.

name: Lickitung
dexEntry: Wields its long tongue deftly, as though it were an arm. The Pokémon's viscous saliva, once it has been collected and boiled down, yields a strong and highly useful adhesive.

name: Koffing
dexEntry: It adores polluted air. Some claim that Koffing used to be more plentiful in the Galar region than they are now.

name: Weezing
dexEntry: It can’t suck in air quite as well as a Galarian Weezing, but the toxins it creates are more potent than those of its counterpart.

name: Rhyhorn
dexEntry: Ludicrously strong—when it butts heads with a mountain, it is the mountain that shatters. But its short legs struggle with turns, and it is incapable of stopping unless it collides with something.

name: Rhydon
dexEntry: Rapidly rotates its horn to bore through bedrock. It swaggers around volcanic regions, protected from the lava's heat by its tough, armorlike hide.

name: Chansey
dexEntry: This purehearted Pokémon shares its eggs with the injured.

name: Tangela
dexEntry: It is cloaked entirely in blue vines, preventing any glimpse of its true identity. The vines impart a refreshing sensation when chewed—they're useful as a spice.

name: Kangaskhan
dexEntry: There are records of a lost human child being raised by a childless Kangaskhan.

name: Horsea
dexEntry: They swim with dance-like motions and cause whirlpools to form. Horsea compete to see which of them can generate the biggest whirlpool.

name: Seadra
dexEntry: Seadra’s mouth is slender, but its suction power is strong. In an instant, Seadra can suck in food that’s larger than the opening of its mouth.

name: Goldeen
dexEntry: Its dorsal and pectoral fins are strongly developed like muscles. It can swim at a speed of five knots.

name: Seaking
dexEntry: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.

name: Staryu
dexEntry: Fish Pokémon nibble at it, but Staryu isn’t bothered. Its body regenerates quickly, even if part of it is completely torn off.

name: Starmie
dexEntry: Starmie swims by spinning its body at high speed. As this Pokémon cruises through the ocean, it absorbs tiny plankton.

name: Mr-mime
dexEntry: The behavior of this clown-like Pokémon reminds one of pantomime. It creates invisible walls using a force emitted from its fingertips.

name: Scyther
dexEntry: The large, wickedly sharp scythes on its forearms are truly fearsome weapons. Prey's attempts to flee are unfailingly thwarted by this Pokémon's nimble motions.

name: Jynx
dexEntry: The Jynx of Galar often have beautiful and delicate voices. Some of these Pokémon have even gathered a fan base.

name: Electabuzz
dexEntry: Feeds on electrical energy. During sudden showers beneath looming thunderclouds, one can observe Electabuzz scaling tall trees, where the Pokémon will then wait for lightning to strike.

name: Magmar
dexEntry: Legend has it that this Pokémon was born from the crater of a volcano. When wounded, it bathes in lava to heal its body, much as one would soak in a hot spring.

name: Pinsir
dexEntry: This Pokémon clamps its pincers down on its prey and then either splits the prey in half or flings it away.

name: Tauros
dexEntry: The Tauros of the Galar region are volatile in nature, and they won’t allow people to ride on their backs.

name: Magikarp
dexEntry: A feeble, pitiful imbecile of a Pokémon that is nonetheless very hardy. Unperturbed by turbid water, it can be found living in all sorts of places.

name: Gyarados
dexEntry: I suspect this Pokémon to be the true identity of a dragon written of in ancient texts, which claimed that it razed an entire village with white-hot beams from its maw.

name: Lapras
dexEntry: Crossing icy seas is no issue for this cold-resistant Pokémon. Its smooth skin is a little cool to the touch.

name: Ditto
dexEntry: When it encounters another Ditto, it will move faster than normal to duplicate that opponent exactly.

name: Eevee
dexEntry: Harbors the potential to evolve into manifold forms. Within Eevee lies the key to the mysteries of Pokémon evolution—I'm certain of it.

name: Vaporeon
dexEntry: Tests show that its cells closely resemble water molecules, which perhaps explains its ability to conceal its form while submerged. I believe the origins of mermaid folklore lie with this Pokémon.

name: Jolteon
dexEntry: Bristles its fur into sharp, needlelike points when enraged. One can hear electricity crackle in its breath when it exhales.

name: Flareon
dexEntry: Flames burn within a saclike organ inside this Pokémon. When Flareon inhales, these flames grow in intensity, reaching a mighty 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Porygon
dexEntry: It has no discernible heartbeat and does not seem to draw breath, and yet it appears to function without issue. I cannot even begin to explain this utterly bizarre anomaly.

name: Omanyte
dexEntry: This Pokémon is a member of an ancient, extinct species. Omanyte paddles through water with its 10 tentacles, looking like it’s just drifting along.

name: Omastar
dexEntry: Omastar’s sharp fangs could crush rock, but the Pokémon can attack only the prey that come within reach of its tentacles.

name: Kabuto
dexEntry: While some say this species has gone extinct, Kabuto sightings are apparently fairly common in some places.

name: Kabutops
dexEntry: The cause behind the extinction of this species is unknown. Kabutops were aggressive Pokémon that inhabited warm seas.

name: Aerodactyl
dexEntry: Aerodactyl’s sawlike fangs can shred skin to tatters—even the skin of Steel-type Pokémon.

name: Snorlax
dexEntry: This glutton appears in villages without warning and devours the entirety of their rice granaries—such occurrences have long been counted among the gravest of disasters.

name: Articuno
dexEntry: This Pokémon can control ice at will. Articuno is said to live in snowy mountains riddled with permafrost.

name: Zapdos
dexEntry: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon. It’s said that when Zapdos rubs its feathers together, lightning will fall immediately after.

name: Moltres
dexEntry: There are stories of this Pokémon using its radiant, flame-cloaked wings to light up paths for those lost in the mountains.

name: Dratini
dexEntry: This Pokémon was long considered to be no more than a myth. The small lump on a Dratini’s forehead is actually a horn that’s still coming in.

name: Dragonair
dexEntry: This Pokémon gathers power in the orbs on its tail and controls the weather. When enshrouded by an aura, Dragonair has a mystical appearance.

name: Dragonite
dexEntry: This Pokémon is known as the Sea Incarnate. Figureheads that resemble Dragonite decorate the bows of many ships.

name: Mewtwo
dexEntry: Its DNA is almost the same as Mew’s. However, its size and disposition are vastly different.

name: Mew
dexEntry: When viewed through a microscope, this Pokémon’s short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.

name: Chikorita
dexEntry: In battle, Chikorita waves its leaf around to keep the foe at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, becalming the battling Pokémon and creating a cozy, friendly atmosphere all around.

name: Bayleef
dexEntry: Bayleef’s neck is ringed by curled-up leaves. Inside each tubular leaf is a small shoot of a tree. The fragrance of this shoot makes people peppy.

name: Meganium
dexEntry: The fragrance of Meganium’s flower soothes and calms emotions. In battle, this Pokémon gives off more of its becalming scent to blunt the foe’s fighting spirit.

name: Cyndaquil
dexEntry: Hails from the Johto region. Though usually curled into a ball due to its timid disposition, it harbors tremendous firepower.

name: Quilava
dexEntry: This creature's fur is most mysterious—it is wholly impervious to the burning touch of flame. Should Quilava turn its back to you, take heed! Such a posture indicates a forthcoming attack.

name: Typhlosion
dexEntry: Said to purify lost, forsaken souls with its flames and guide them to the afterlife. I believe its form has been influenced by the energy of the sacred mountain towering at Hisui's center.

name: Totodile
dexEntry: Despite the smallness of its body, Totodile’s jaws are very powerful. While the Pokémon may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.

name: Croconaw
dexEntry: Once Croconaw has clamped its jaws on its foe, it will absolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are forked back like barbed fishhooks, they become impossible to remove when they have sunk in.

name: Feraligatr
dexEntry: Feraligatr intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth. In battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful hind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.

name: Sentret
dexEntry: When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this Pokémon becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.

name: Furret
dexEntry: Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this Pokémon is very nimble and fleet.

name: Hoothoot
dexEntry: It begins to hoot at the same time every day. Some Trainers use them in place of clocks.

name: Noctowl
dexEntry: When it needs to think, it rotates its head 180 degrees to sharpen its intellectual power.

name: Ledyba
dexEntry: These very cowardly Pokémon join together and use Reflect to protect their nest.

name: Ledian
dexEntry: It flies through the night sky, sprinkling sparkly dust. According to some, if that dust sticks to you, good things will happen to you.

name: Spinarak
dexEntry: Although the poison from its fangs isn’t that strong, it’s potent enough to weaken prey that gets caught in its web.

name: Ariados
dexEntry: It spews threads from its mouth to catch its prey. When night falls, it leaves its web to go hunt aggressively.

name: Crobat
dexEntry: Its hind limbs have become another set of wings. Crobat expertly maneuvers its four wings to dart in exquisite fashion through even the most confined caves without losing any speed.

name: Chinchou
dexEntry: On the dark ocean floor, its only means of communication is its constantly flashing lights.

name: Lanturn
dexEntry: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.

name: Pichu
dexEntry: Pichu stores electricity in the sacs on its cheeks but discharges it inadvertently when agitated or excited. Being yet immature, the Pokémon's handling of electricity is rather inept.

name: Cleffa
dexEntry: In silhouette, they resemble twinkling starlight. When shooting stars rain from the night sky, Cleffa gather in numbers and dance as though they are indeed incarnations of the stars.

name: Igglybuff
dexEntry: Taking advantage of the softness of its body, Igglybuff moves as if bouncing. Its body turns a deep pink when its temperature rises.

name: Togepi
dexEntry: This ovate creature is frequently mistaken for a moving egg when encountered out in the fields or in the mountains. Its guileless smile soothes the soul.

name: Togetic
dexEntry: No records exist of Togetic being seen in the wilds. Rumors abound that it evolves under the loving care of a trusted human companion, upon whom the Pokémon then bestows great joy.

name: Natu
dexEntry: Because its wings aren’t yet fully grown, it has to hop to get around. It is always staring at something.

name: Xatu
dexEntry: This odd Pokémon can see both the past and the future. It eyes the sun’s movement all day.

name: Mareep
dexEntry: Rubbing its fleece generates electricity. You’ll want to pet it because it’s cute, but if you use your bare hand, you’ll get a painful shock.

name: Flaaffy
dexEntry: It stores electricity in its fluffy fleece. If it stores up too much, it will start to go bald in those patches.

name: Ampharos
dexEntry: Its tail shines bright and strong. It has been prized since long ago as a beacon for sailors.

name: Bellossom
dexEntry: Bellossom gather at times and appear to dance. They say that the dance is a ritual to summon the sun.

name: Marill
dexEntry: Even after Marill swims in a cold sea, its water- repellent fur dries almost as soon as Marill leaves the water. That’s why this Pokémon is never cold.

name: Azumarill
dexEntry: These Pokémon create air-filled bubbles. When Azurill play in rivers, Azumarill will cover them with these bubbles.

name: Sudowoodo
dexEntry: Though it pretends to be a tree, it fails to fool even children. To the touch, its body feels more like rock than tree bark. Sudowoodo's extreme aversion to water merits special note.

name: Politoed
dexEntry: The cry of a male is louder than that of a female. Male Politoed with deep, menacing voices find more popularity with the opposite gender.

name: Hoppip
dexEntry: This Pokémon drifts and floats with the wind. If it senses the approach of strong winds, Hoppip links its leaves with other Hoppip to prepare against being blown away.

name: Skiploom
dexEntry: Skiploom’s flower blossoms when the temperature rises above 64 degrees Fahrenheit. How much the flower opens depends on the temperature. For that reason, this Pokémon is sometimes used as a thermometer.

name: Jumpluff
dexEntry: Jumpluff rides warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to foreign lands. The Pokémon descends to the ground when it encounters cold air while it is floating.

name: Aipom
dexEntry: This treetop dweller possesses a tail as dexterous as a hand. Ancient writings describe this Pokémon as a one-armed oddity.

name: Sunkern
dexEntry: Sunkern tries to move as little as it possibly can. It does so because it tries to conserve all the nutrients it has stored in its body for its evolution. It will not eat a thing, subsisting only on morning dew.

name: Sunflora
dexEntry: Sunflora converts solar energy into nutrition. It moves around actively in the daytime when it is warm. It stops moving as soon as the sun goes down for the night.

name: Yanma
dexEntry: Its frail wings are so thin that one can see clear through them. However, during flight these wings exhibit the power to churn air with force enough to launch a house skyward.

name: Wooper
dexEntry: When walking on land, it covers its body with a poisonous film that keeps its skin from dehydrating.

name: Quagsire
dexEntry: Its body is always slimy. It often bangs its head on the river bottom as it swims but seems not to care.

name: Espeon
dexEntry: Wields an arcane power with which it can predict the weather and even people's thoughts. When bathed in sunshine, the scarlet orb on its brow glows and builds energy.

name: Umbreon
dexEntry: It is most active in the wee hours of the night, when moonlight bathes the land. Its large eyes can pierce the darkness and perceive prey with absolute clarity.

name: Murkrow
dexEntry: Widely shunned as a bearer of ill fortune. Upon crossing paths with this creature, I've been told one must chant ”Workrum, Workrum—bad luck, don't come” as a protective incantation.

name: Slowking
dexEntry: Slowking can solve any problem presented to it, but no one can understand a thing Slowking says.

name: Misdreavus
dexEntry: It conceals itself in darkness, sending chills up travelers' spines with its childlike weeping. As it observes the frightened travelers with glee, the red orbs upon its chest let off an eerie light.

name: Unown
dexEntry: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I've pointed out that the species' many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.

name: Wobbuffet
dexEntry: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.

name: Girafarig
dexEntry: Girafarig’s rear head contains a tiny brain that is too small for thinking. However, the rear head doesn’t need to sleep, so it can keep watch over its surroundings 24 hours a day.

name: Pineco
dexEntry: It sticks tree bark to itself with its saliva, making itself thicker and larger. Elderly Pineco are ridiculously huge.

name: Forretress
dexEntry: In the moment that it gulps down its prey, the inside of its shell is exposed, but to this day, no one has ever seen that sight.

name: Dunsparce
dexEntry: The nests Dunsparce live in are mazes of tunnels. They never get lost in their own nests—they can tell where they are by the scent of the dirt.

name: Gligar
dexEntry: Its tail is tipped by a thick, horrible stinger. To bring down prey, it will first obscure their vision by covering their faces with its body, and then it will use the stinger to inject them with venom.

name: Steelix
dexEntry: This Pokémon evolved through use of a strange item. Its body is coated with steel powder and notably hard—not even diamond can leave so much as a scratch.

name: Snubbull
dexEntry: In contrast to its appearance, it’s quite timid. When playing with other puppy Pokémon, it sometimes gets bullied.

name: Granbull
dexEntry: Although it’s popular with young people, Granbull is timid and sensitive, so it’s totally incompetent as a watchdog.

name: Qwilfish
dexEntry: Fishers detest this troublesome Pokémon because it sprays poison from its spines, getting it everywhere. A different form of Qwilfish lives in other regions.

name: Scizor
dexEntry: Evolved by way of a curious item. The shell covering its body has been shown to be stronger than forged steel.

name: Shuckle
dexEntry: The berries stored in its vaselike shell eventually become a thick, pulpy juice.

name: Heracross
dexEntry: This Pokémon has an unparalleled horn. Heracross itself demonstrates tremendous power—it's capable of throwing several people trained in the traditional arts of war at once.

name: Sneasel
dexEntry: Its sturdy, curved claws are ideal for traversing precipitous cliffs. From the tips of these claws drips a venom that infiltrates the nerves of any prey caught in Sneasel's grasp.

name: Teddiursa
dexEntry: It licks its paws because of the sweet honey that has soaked into them. It is cunning, stealing into the nests of Combee and taking for itself the honey that the Combee have amassed.

name: Ursaring
dexEntry: When the cold season arrives in Hisui, this Pokémon will wander fields and mountains alike in search of its favorite berries. Ursaring's hunger during this time makes it a ferocious danger.

name: Slugma
dexEntry: Slugma does not have any blood in its body. Instead, intensely hot magma circulates throughout this Pokémon’s body, carrying essential nutrients and oxygen to its organs.

name: Magcargo
dexEntry: Magcargo’s body temperature is approximately 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit. Water is vaporized on contact. If this Pokémon is caught in the rain, the raindrops instantly turn into steam, cloaking the area in a thick fog.

name: Swinub
dexEntry: Swinub excels at sniffing out mushrooms buried beneath grass or snow. Since ancient times, the people of Hisui have often relied upon this skill.

name: Piloswine
dexEntry: The long fur of this Pokémon covers its eyes, ears, and even limbs, allowing Piloswine to resist harshly frigid conditions. The Pokémon's white tusks can be used to defeat its enemies.

name: Corsola
dexEntry: These Pokémon live in warm seas. In prehistoric times, many lived in the oceans around the Galar region as well.

name: Remoraid
dexEntry: Spits water from its mouth with incredible accuracy. It captures Burmy by shooting them down off the branches from which they dangle.

name: Octillery
dexEntry: While Octillery still shoots water from its mouth, the drastic anatomical difference between it and Remoraid meant that for a long time, no one believed the former evolved from the latter.

name: Delibird
dexEntry: It has a generous habit of sharing its food with people and Pokémon, so it’s always scrounging around for more food.

name: Mantine
dexEntry: This calm and gentle Pokémon swims gracefully through the sea. After building speed, it can leap out of the water. It is often misidentified as a bird Pokémon due to this behavior.

name: Skarmory
dexEntry: People fashion swords from Skarmory’s shed feathers, so this Pokémon is a popular element in heraldic designs.

name: Houndour
dexEntry: They make repeated eerie howls before dawn to call attention to their pack.

name: Houndoom
dexEntry: Identifiable by its eerie howls, people a long time ago thought it was the grim reaper and feared it.

name: Kingdra
dexEntry: Scales shed by this Pokémon have such a splendorous gleam to them that they’ve been given to royalty as gifts.

name: Phanpy
dexEntry: Phanpy uses its long nose to shower itself. When others gather around, they thoroughly douse each other with water. These Pokémon can be seen drying their soaking-wet bodies at the edge of water.

name: Donphan
dexEntry: If Donphan were to tackle with its hard body, even a house could be destroyed. Using its massive strength, the Pokémon helps clear rock and mud slides that block mountain trails.

name: Porygon2
dexEntry: A bizarre item caused this Pokémon to evolve. While it now exhibits many new gestures and expressions, its biology remains inscrutable.

name: Stantler
dexEntry: Its strangely shaped antlers have the power to bewitch those who see them. Medicine made by grinding up the black orbs from fallen antlers is an effective treatment for insomnia.

name: Smeargle
dexEntry: It draws symbols with the fluid that oozes from the tip of its tail. Depending on the symbol, Smeargle fanatics will pay big money for them.

name: Tyrogue
dexEntry: Even though it is small, it can’t be ignored because it will slug any handy target without warning.

name: Hitmontop
dexEntry: After doing a handstand to throw off the opponent’s timing, it presents its fancy kick moves.

name: Smoochum
dexEntry: This is a very curious Pokémon. Smoochum decides what it likes and dislikes by touching things with its lips.

name: Elekid
dexEntry: They generate electricity by spinning their arms. During a thunderstorm, if one hears the lively voices of children out in the wilderness, what one is actually hearing are the voices of Elekid.

name: Magby
dexEntry: This Pokémon lives in volcanic areas. With each breath, sparks spurt from its mouth and nose. When Magby is in good health, its flames gain a yellow tint.

name: Miltank
dexEntry: This Pokémon needs to be milked every day, or else it will fall ill. The flavor of Miltank milk changes with the seasons.

name: Blissey
dexEntry: A kindhearted Pokémon that will care for any sick person or Pokémon until their health improves. The eggs it lays are delicious and bring good fortune to those who eat them.

name: Raikou
dexEntry: Raikou embodies the speed of lightning. The roars of this Pokémon send shock waves shuddering through the air and shake the ground as if lightning bolts had come crashing down.

name: Entei
dexEntry: Entei embodies the passion of magma. This Pokémon is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It sends up massive bursts of fire that utterly consume all that they touch.

name: Suicune
dexEntry: Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gracefulness. This Pokémon has the power to purify dirty water.

name: Larvitar
dexEntry: It feeds on soil. After it has eaten a large mountain, it will fall asleep so it can grow.

name: Pupitar
dexEntry: It will not stay still, even while it’s a pupa. It already has arms and legs under its solid shell.

name: Tyranitar
dexEntry: The quakes caused when it walks make even great mountains crumble and change the surrounding terrain.

name: Lugia
dexEntry: Lugia’s wings pack devastating power—a light fluttering of its wings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, this Pokémon chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.

name: Ho-oh
dexEntry: Ho-Oh’s feathers glow in seven colors depending on the angle at which they are struck by light. These feathers are said to bring happiness to the bearers. This Pokémon is said to live at the foot of a rainbow.

name: Celebi
dexEntry: This Pokémon traveled through time to come from the future. It bolsters grass and trees with its own strength, and it can heal wounds, too.

name: Treecko
dexEntry: Treecko is cool, calm, and collected—it never panics under any situation. If a bigger foe were to glare at this Pokémon, it would glare right back without conceding an inch of ground.

name: Grovyle
dexEntry: This Pokémon adeptly flies from branch to branch in trees. In a forest, no Pokémon can ever hope to catch a fleeing Grovyle however fast they may be.

name: Sceptile
dexEntry: Sceptile has seeds growing on its back. They are said to be bursting with nutrients that revitalize trees. This Pokémon raises the trees in a forest with loving care.

name: Torchic
dexEntry: Torchic has a place inside its body where it keeps its flame. Give it a hug—it will be glowing with warmth. This Pokémon is covered all over by a fluffy coat of down.

name: Combusken
dexEntry: Combusken battles with the intensely hot flames it spews from its beak and with outstandingly destructive kicks. This Pokémon’s cry is very loud and distracting.

name: Blaziken
dexEntry: Blaziken has incredibly strong legs—it can easily clear a 30-story building in one leap. This Pokémon’s blazing punches leave its foes scorched and blackened.

name: Mudkip
dexEntry: In water, Mudkip breathes using the gills on its cheeks. If it is faced with a tight situation in battle, this Pokémon will unleash its amazing power—it can crush rocks bigger than itself.

name: Marshtomp
dexEntry: Marshtomp is much faster at traveling through mud than it is at swimming. This Pokémon’s hindquarters exhibit obvious development, giving it the ability to walk on just its hind legs.

name: Swampert
dexEntry: Swampert predicts storms by sensing subtle differences in the sounds of waves and tidal winds with its fins. If a storm is approaching, it piles up boulders to protect itself.

name: Poochyena
dexEntry: Poochyena is an omnivore—it will eat anything. A distinguishing feature is how large its fangs are compared to its body. This Pokémon tries to intimidate its foes by making the hair on its tail bristle out.

name: Mightyena
dexEntry: Mightyena travel and act as a pack in the wild. The memory of its life in the wild compels the Pokémon to obey only those Trainers that it recognizes to possess superior skill.

name: Zigzagoon
dexEntry: Zigzagoon that adapted to regions outside Galar acquired this appearance. If you’ve lost something, this Pokémon can likely find it.

name: Linoone
dexEntry: It uses its explosive speed and razor-sharp claws to bring down prey. Running along winding paths is not its strong suit.

name: Wurmple
dexEntry: Likes sap and is abundant in the wild. Why it evolves into various different forms is unknown. One cannot tell from a Wurmple's appearance which form it will take when it evolves.

name: Silcoon
dexEntry: Wraps itself in thin strings of silk while it stores energy for evolution. It can't extend its limbs and its movement is slow, but its eyes keep a sharp lookout—Silcoon is always on guard.

name: Beautifly
dexEntry: A colorful and incredibly beautiful but also greedy Pokémon. In an effort to keep its favorite food all to itself, it will chase away Combee as they try to gather nectar.

name: Cascoon
dexEntry: The silk coating its body is thin but sufficiently strong. Cascoon's silk has a luster and texture superior to that of Silcoon's, and clothes made using Cascoon silk are regarded as top-notch.

name: Dustox
dexEntry: Tends to be drawn to bonfires on dark nights. Difficult to chase away from settlements because of the way it scatters highly toxic scales.

name: Lotad
dexEntry: Its leaf grew too large for it to live on land. That is how it began to live floating in the water.

name: Lombre
dexEntry: It lives at the water’s edge where it is sunny. It sleeps on a bed of water grass by day and becomes active at night.

name: Ludicolo
dexEntry: If it hears festive music, it begins moving in rhythm in order to amplify its power.

name: Seedot
dexEntry: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.

name: Nuzleaf
dexEntry: They live in holes bored in large trees. The sound of Nuzleaf’s grass flute fills listeners with dread.

name: Shiftry
dexEntry: It lives quietly in the deep forest. It is said to create chilly winter winds with the fans it holds.

name: Taillow
dexEntry: Taillow is young—it has only just left its nest. As a result, it sometimes becomes lonesome and cries at night. This Pokémon feeds on Wurmple that live in forests.

name: Swellow
dexEntry: Swellow is very conscientious about the upkeep of its glossy wings. Once two Swellow are gathered, they diligently take care of cleaning each other’s wings.

name: Wingull
dexEntry: It soars on updrafts without flapping its wings. It makes a nest on sheer cliffs at the sea’s edge.

name: Pelipper
dexEntry: Skimming the water’s surface, it dips its large bill in the sea, scoops up food and water, and carries it.

name: Ralts
dexEntry: Tends to prefer people with a chipper disposition to those who are gloomy, but it has shown no discrimination with regard to age or gender. Needs more research.

name: Kirlia
dexEntry: It resembles a maiden in appearance, but it wields strange powers to project visions of paradise. I suspect the crimson ornaments on its head are the key to its abilities.

name: Gardevoir
dexEntry: It will dedicate itself to defending a master it has come to adore. Its pure white dress, reminiscent of those worn by ladies of nobility, is the dress of one who is willing to risk their life.

name: Surskit
dexEntry: It lives in ponds and marshes that feature lots of plant life. It often fights with Dewpider, whose habitat and diet are similar.

name: Masquerain
dexEntry: Its thin, winglike antennae are highly absorbent. It waits out rainy days in tree hollows.

name: Shroomish
dexEntry: If Shroomish senses danger, it shakes its body and scatters spores from the top of its head. This Pokémon’s spores are so toxic, they make trees and weeds wilt.

name: Breloom
dexEntry: The seeds ringing Breloom’s tail are made of hardened toxic spores. It is horrible to eat the seeds. Just taking a bite of this Pokémon’s seed will cause your stomach to rumble.

name: Slakoth
dexEntry: Slakoth’s heart beats just once a minute. Whatever happens, it is content to loaf around motionless. It is rare to see this Pokémon in motion.

name: Vigoroth
dexEntry: Vigoroth is simply incapable of remaining still. Even when it tries to sleep, the blood in its veins grows agitated, compelling this Pokémon to run wild throughout the jungle before it can settle down.

name: Slaking
dexEntry: Wherever Slaking live, rings of over a yard in diameter appear in grassy fields. They are made by the Pokémon as it eats all the grass within reach while lying prone on the ground.

name: Nincada
dexEntry: It can sometimes live underground for more than 10 years. It absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees.

name: Ninjask
dexEntry: This Pokémon is so quick, it is said to be able to avoid any attack. It loves to feed on tree sap.

name: Shedinja
dexEntry: A strange Pokémon—it flies without moving its wings, has a hollow shell for a body, and does not breathe.

name: Whismur
dexEntry: When Whismur cries, the sound of its own voice startles it, making the Pokémon cry even louder. It cries until it’s exhausted, then it falls asleep.

name: Loudred
dexEntry: The force of this Pokémon’s loud voice isn’t just the sound—it’s also the wave of air pressure that blows opponents away and damages them.

name: Exploud
dexEntry: This Pokémon can do more than just shout. To communicate with others of its kind, it’ll emit all sorts of sounds from the holes in its body.

name: Makuhita
dexEntry: There’s a rumor of a traditional recipe for stew that Trainers can use to raise strong Makuhita.

name: Hariyama
dexEntry: Hariyama that are big and fat aren’t necessarily strong. There are some small ones that move nimbly and use moves skillfully.

name: Azurill
dexEntry: Although Azurill are normally docile, an angry one will swing around the big ball on its tail and try to smash its opponents.

name: Nosepass
dexEntry: Once the people of Hisui discovered that its red nose always points north, they grew to rely on it greatly when traveling afar. The nose seems to work in a similar way to ancient compasses.

name: Skitty
dexEntry: Skitty is known to chase around playfully after its own tail. In the wild, this Pokémon lives in holes in the trees of forests. It is very popular as a pet because of its adorable looks.

name: Delcatty
dexEntry: Delcatty sleeps anywhere it wants without keeping a permanent nest. If other Pokémon approach it as it sleeps, this Pokémon will never fight—it will just move away somewhere else.

name: Sableye
dexEntry: It feeds on gemstone crystals. In darkness, its eyes sparkle with the glitter of jewels.

name: Mawile
dexEntry: It chomps with its gaping mouth. Its huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed.

name: Aron
dexEntry: When Aron evolves, its steel armor peels off. In ancient times, people would collect Aron’s shed armor and make good use of it in their daily lives.

name: Lairon
dexEntry: During territorial disputes, Lairon fight by slamming into each other. Close inspection of their steel armor reveals scratches and dents.

name: Aggron
dexEntry: Long ago, there was a king who wore a helmet meant to resemble the head of an Aggron. He was trying to channel the Pokémon’s strength.

name: Meditite
dexEntry: Meditite heightens its inner energy through meditation. It survives on just one berry a day. Minimal eating is another aspect of this Pokémon’s training.

name: Medicham
dexEntry: Through the power of meditation, Medicham developed its sixth sense. It gained the ability to use psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon is known to meditate for a whole month without eating.

name: Electrike
dexEntry: It stores electricity in its fur. It gives off sparks from all over its body in seasons when the air is dry.

name: Manectric
dexEntry: It rarely appears before people. It is said to nest where lightning has fallen.

name: Plusle
dexEntry: When Plusle is cheering on its partner, it flashes with electric sparks from all over its body. If its partner loses, this Pokémon cries loudly.

name: Minun
dexEntry: Minun loves to cheer on its partner in battle. It gives off sparks from its body while it is doing so. If its partner is in trouble, this Pokémon gives off increasing amounts of sparks.

name: Volbeat
dexEntry: Volbeat’s tail glows like a lightbulb. With other Volbeat, it uses its tail to draw geometric shapes in the night sky. This Pokémon loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.

name: Illumise
dexEntry: Illumise leads a flight of illuminated Volbeat to draw signs in the night sky. This Pokémon is said to earn greater respect from its peers by composing more complex designs in the sky.

name: Roselia
dexEntry: Though beautiful, it has highly poisonous thorns. There is an old tradition in my homeland wherein one would send these thorns to an opponent to challenge them to a duel.

name: Gulpin
dexEntry: Most of Gulpin’s body is made up of its stomach—its heart and brain are very small in comparison. This Pokémon’s stomach contains special enzymes that dissolve anything.

name: Swalot
dexEntry: Swalot has no teeth, so what it eats, it swallows whole, no matter what. Its cavernous mouth yawns widely. An automobile tire could easily fit inside this Pokémon’s mouth.

name: Carvanha
dexEntry: These Pokémon have sharp fangs and powerful jaws. Sailors avoid Carvanha dens at all costs.

name: Sharpedo
dexEntry: This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sea. Any ship entering the waters Sharpedo calls home will be attacked—no exceptions.

name: Wailmer
dexEntry: When it sucks in a large volume of seawater, it becomes like a big, bouncy ball. It eats a ton of food daily.

name: Wailord
dexEntry: Its immense size is the reason for its popularity. Wailord watching is a favorite sightseeing activity in various parts of the world.

name: Numel
dexEntry: Numel stores magma of almost 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit within its body. If it gets wet, the magma cools and hardens. In that event, the Pokémon’s body grows heavy and its movements become sluggish.

name: Camerupt
dexEntry: The humps on Camerupt’s back are formed by a transformation of its bones. They sometimes blast out molten magma. This Pokémon apparently erupts often when it is enraged.

name: Torkoal
dexEntry: You find abandoned coal mines full of them. They dig tirelessly in search of coal.

name: Spoink
dexEntry: Spoink keeps a pearl on top of its head. The pearl functions to amplify this Pokémon’s psychokinetic powers. It is therefore on a constant search for a bigger pearl.

name: Grumpig
dexEntry: Grumpig uses the black pearls on its body to wield its fantastic powers. When it is doing so, it dances bizarrely. This Pokémon’s black pearls are valuable as works of art.

name: Spinda
dexEntry: Each Spinda’s spot pattern is different. With its stumbling movements, it evades opponents’ attacks brilliantly!

name: Trapinch
dexEntry: It makes an inescapable conical pit and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.

name: Vibrava
dexEntry: To help make its wings grow, it dissolves quantities of prey in its digestive juices and guzzles them down every day.

name: Flygon
dexEntry: It is nicknamed the Desert Spirit because the flapping of its wings sounds like a woman singing.

name: Cacnea
dexEntry: The more arid and harsh the environment, the more pretty and fragrant a flower Cacnea grows. This Pokémon battles by wildly swinging its thorny arms.

name: Cacturne
dexEntry: If a traveler is going through a desert in the thick of night, Cacturne will follow in a ragtag group. The Pokémon are biding their time, waiting for the traveler to tire and become incapable of moving.

name: Swablu
dexEntry: Since Swablu looks like a cumulus cloud, foes can have a hard time finding it. Apparently its wings turned white over many generations.

name: Altaria
dexEntry: This Pokémon has a kind disposition, but if it’s provoked, it will threaten opponents with shrill cries before attacking them without mercy.

name: Zangoose
dexEntry: Zangoose usually stays on all fours, but when angered, it gets up on its hind legs and extends its claws. This Pokémon shares a bitter rivalry with Seviper that dates back over generations.

name: Seviper
dexEntry: Seviper’s swordlike tail serves two purposes—it slashes foes and douses them with secreted poison. This Pokémon will not give up its long-running blood feud with Zangoose.

name: Lunatone
dexEntry: It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike 40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.

name: Solrock
dexEntry: Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is strong during the daytime. When it spins, its body shines.

name: Barboach
dexEntry: Makes its home in swamps with murky water. The poor visibility hides this Pokémon from predators, and the slime on its body makes grasping it difficult.

name: Whiscash
dexEntry: Strikes its caudal fin against the swamp bed to shake the ground and startle its prey. It will then swallow the fleeing prey whole. People mistook this behavior as the cause of earthquakes.

name: Corphish
dexEntry: It was originally a Pokémon from afar that escaped to the wild. It can adapt to the dirtiest river.

name: Crawdaunt
dexEntry: A brutish Pokémon that loves to battle. It will crash itself into any foe that approaches its nest.

name: Baltoy
dexEntry: It was discovered in ancient ruins. While moving, it constantly spins. It stands on one foot even when asleep.

name: Claydol
dexEntry: It appears to have been born from clay dolls made by ancient people. It uses telekinesis to float and move.

name: Lileep
dexEntry: Lileep clings to rocks on the seabed. When prey comes close, this Pokémon entangles it with petallike tentacles.

name: Cradily
dexEntry: Once Cradily catches prey in its tentacles, it digests them whole and absorbs their nutrients.

name: Anorith
dexEntry: Anorith can swim swiftly by pulling its eight wings through the water like oars on a boat. This Pokémon is an ancestor of modern bug Pokémon.

name: Armaldo
dexEntry: Though it lives on land, it’s also a good swimmer. It dives into the ocean in search of prey, using its sharp claws to take down its quarry.

name: Feebas
dexEntry: It is a shabby and ugly Pokémon. However, it is very hardy and can survive on little water.

name: Milotic
dexEntry: It’s said that a glimpse of a Milotic and its beauty will calm any hostile emotions you’re feeling.

name: Castform
dexEntry: Its form changes depending on the weather. The rougher conditions get, the rougher Castform’s disposition!

name: Kecleon
dexEntry: Its color changes for concealment and also when its mood or health changes. The darker the color, the healthier it is.

name: Shuppet
dexEntry: There’s a proverb that says, “Shun the house where Shuppet gather in the growing dusk.”

name: Banette
dexEntry: Resentment at being cast off made it spring into being. Some say that treating it well will satisfy it, and it will once more become a stuffed toy.

name: Duskull
dexEntry: I've heard that the children of Hisui all begin to behave once they've been told the story of how this Pokémon roams about before the witching hour to spirit away misbehaving children.

name: Dusclops
dexEntry: There are rumors that peeking inside its bandage-wrapped body will cause one to get pulled in through the gaps between the bandages, never to return. I've been too scared to verify.

name: Tropius
dexEntry: Bunches of delicious fruit grow around its neck. In warm areas, many ranches raise Tropius.

name: Chimecho
dexEntry: Can emit waves of air powerful enough to knock out prey taller than itself. I hypothesize that it amplifies the faint sound of wind within its body.

name: Absol
dexEntry: Because of this Pokémon’s ability to detect danger, people mistook Absol as a bringer of doom.

name: Wynaut
dexEntry: It tends to move in a pack with others. They cluster in a tight group to sleep in a cave.

name: Snorunt
dexEntry: Arrives alongside the first snow. It's thought that homes Snorunt visit will prosper for many generations. By tradition, one might offer a lump of ice made from pure water at one's front door.

name: Glalie
dexEntry: It covers its body with an armor of ice harder than steel. Uses its breath to freeze prey, which it then devours as if they were frozen desserts.

name: Spheal
dexEntry: During the season when drift ice approaches the shore, Spheal prefers living on the ice—where fewer predators lurk—rather than the land. Its fur retains heat superbly and resists harsh cold.

name: Sealeo
dexEntry: Its white whiskers are very sensitive. Sealeo will balance Spheal on the tip of its nose, checking its scent and its feel to be sure the Spheal is healthy.

name: Walrein
dexEntry: Its thick tusks are strong enough to shatter drift ice. They have been known to break, but they will grow back by the next year. The Hisui region is well known for these broken tusks.

name: Clamperl
dexEntry: Clamperl’s pearls are exceedingly precious. They can be more than 10 times as costly as Shellder’s pearls.

name: Huntail
dexEntry: Deep seas are their habitat. According to tradition, when Huntail wash up onshore, something unfortunate will happen.

name: Gorebyss
dexEntry: It sucks bodily fluids out of its prey. The leftover meat sinks to the seafloor, where it becomes food for other Pokémon.

name: Relicanth
dexEntry: This Pokémon was discovered during deep-sea exploration. Its appearance hasn’t changed in 100,000,000 years, so it’s called a living fossil.

name: Luvdisc
dexEntry: Luvdisc makes its home in coral reefs in warm seas. It especially likes sleeping in the space between Corsola’s branches.

name: Bagon
dexEntry: Bagon is a solitary Pokémon that doesn’t form groups with others of its kind. It also has a head hard enough to cleave a boulder in one strike.

name: Shelgon
dexEntry: Shelgon ignores its hunger entirely, never eating any food. Apparently, Shelgon will evolve once all its energy stores are used up.

name: Salamence
dexEntry: While basking in the joy of flight generally keeps this Pokémon in high spirits, Salamence turns into an uncontrollable menace if something angers it.

name: Beldum
dexEntry: The cells in this Pokémon’s body are composed of magnetic material. Instead of blood, magnetic forces flow through Beldum’s body.

name: Metang
dexEntry: Using magnetic forces to stay aloft, this Pokémon flies at high speeds, weaving through harsh mountain terrain in pursuit of prey.

name: Metagross
dexEntry: Metagross is the result of the fusion of two Metang. This Pokémon defeats its opponents through use of its supercomputer-level brain.

name: Regirock
dexEntry: Cutting-edge technology was used to study the internals of this Pokémon’s rock body, but nothing was found—not even a brain or a heart.

name: Regice
dexEntry: This Pokémon’s body is made of solid ice. It’s said that Regice was born beneath thick ice in the ice age.

name: Registeel
dexEntry: It’s rumored that this Pokémon was born deep underground in the planet’s mantle and that it emerged onto the surface 10,000 years ago.

name: Latias
dexEntry: Latias is highly intelligent and capable of understanding human speech. It is covered with a glass-like down. The Pokémon enfolds its body with its down and refracts light to alter its appearance.

name: Latios
dexEntry: Latios will only open its heart to a Trainer with a compassionate spirit. This Pokémon can fly faster than a jet plane by folding its forelegs to minimize air resistance.

name: Kyogre
dexEntry: Kyogre is said to be the personification of the sea itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Groudon, as each sought to gain the power of nature.

name: Groudon
dexEntry: Through Primal Reversion and with nature’s full power, it will take back its true form. It can cause magma to erupt and expand the landmass of the world.

name: Rayquaza
dexEntry: It flies forever through the ozone layer, consuming meteoroids for sustenance. The many meteoroids in its body provide the energy it needs to Mega Evolve.

name: Jirachi
dexEntry: It’s believed that when this Pokémon wakes from its 1,000-year slumber, it will grant any wishes written on the notes attached to its head.

name: Deoxys-normal
dexEntry: Deoxys emerged from a virus that came from space. It is highly intelligent and wields psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon shoots lasers from the crystalline organ on its chest.

name: Turtwig
dexEntry: This Pokémon becomes more energetic the more sunlight there is. The part resembling a shell is similar to silt and is slightly damp and warm to the touch.

name: Grotle
dexEntry: Appears where there is clean spring water. The fruit that grows on the shrubs on its shell is sweet, nutritious, and truly delicious.

name: Torterra
dexEntry: This remarkable, large-bodied Pokémon would serve beautifully as borrowed scenery for a garden, and its strength is peerless. Torterra roams the wilderness in search of clean water.

name: Chimchar
dexEntry: Full of vigor and always in high spirits. It was once known by the name ”Lantern-Tail” and feared as some kind of apparition.

name: Monferno
dexEntry: The deeper the blue on its face, the more powerful it will grow to become. It leaps about every which way and lands powerful blows against its opponents with the flame on its tail.

name: Infernape
dexEntry: A tall, hardy Pokémon with a dazzling appearance. It shrouds itself in flame and battles as if engaged in dance—truly a sight to behold.

name: Piplup
dexEntry: Prefers cold climes and appears along coasts. It's an adorable little thing—as cute as any child—but it's also prideful, unwilling to accept handouts from people.

name: Prinplup
dexEntry: It swims gracefully through the frigid sea and sings with a voice like the roaring tide. It has powerful, sturdy wings and dignity to match.

name: Empoleon
dexEntry: Since ancient times, it has been revered by the people of Hisui, who call it the Master of the Waves. Its wings are a match for even master-crafted blades.

name: Starly
dexEntry: They live in the fields and mountains, gathering in large flocks. Their cries are quite obnoxious. Though small, their wings are strong—a strike from them leaves pain that persists for a week.

name: Staravia
dexEntry: They form remarkably large flocks and are constantly fighting amongst themselves. I suspect that those with magnificent plumes on their heads are the strong ones.

name: Staraptor
dexEntry: It has left the flock, having gained strength enough to survive on its own. The astounding force with which Staraptor flies through the air allows it to carry away large, burly targets.

name: Bidoof
dexEntry: Bidoof has an unsophisticated face and is rarely flustered by anything. There have been incidents involving Bidoof sauntering into villages and gnawing on the houses without a single care.

name: Bibarel
dexEntry: Bibarel fur repels water and is also a fantastic material for heat retention. These Pokémon create dams on rivers to live in.

name: Kricketot
dexEntry: When the trees take on new hues, more of these Pokémon appear. The tone they create by striking their antennae together resembles that of the marimba, an instrument of foreign lands.

name: Kricketune
dexEntry: It uses its cutlass-like arms to produce sound, the melody of which varies from individual to individual. It is a worthwhile endeavor to seek out one's favorite tunes.

name: Shinx
dexEntry: Shakes its body to generate electricity. Its stature belies its aggression—one must be patient to tame this Pokémon.

name: Luxio
dexEntry: Proudly uses its electrified claws as weapons. It seems to be a gracious Pokémon, evenly sharing the spoils of the hunt with others of its kind.

name: Luxray
dexEntry: They form packs, each having one male as leader. Legends say that when Luxray's two eyes shimmer with gold, the Pokémon can see through anything.

name: Budew
dexEntry: When the sun's light strengthens, the bud atop this Pokémon's head opens. This is a sign to the people that the harsh winter is over, and the season of budding has begun.

name: Roserade
dexEntry: Hidden within the bouquet on each hand are thorned whips loaded with virulent poison. Roserade moves gracefully as it corners its prey and mercilessly lashes them with its whips.

name: Cranidos
dexEntry: An incredibly rare sight. They duel each other by ramming their heads together, and the resulting sound echoes throughout the area like the pealing of a bell.

name: Rampardos
dexEntry: Very little is known about its biology. Can knock down massive trees by smashing its beautiful, pearl-like crown against them.

name: Shieldon
dexEntry: Much remains unknown about this Pokémon, as few have ever seen it. However, we know that it is calm and dislikes conflict, and it enjoys polishing its face against trees and rocks.

name: Bastiodon
dexEntry: Its face is sturdy—as strong as diamond—and this hardness offers a very stable defense. Much about this species is still unknown, such as its natural habitat.

name: Burmy
dexEntry: If its cloak is even slightly damaged, Burmy will immediately repair it with whatever is close at hand. The Pokémon within the cloak is scrawny and vulnerable to the cold.

name: Wormadam-plant
dexEntry: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.

name: Mothim
dexEntry: Scatters steel-colored scales as it flaps its wings. Despite being observed feeding primarily on the nectar of flowers, Mothim is not often seen around flower gardens.

name: Combee
dexEntry: They swear fealty to a queen Pokémon and work diligently to gather nectar. Each swarm produces a different flavor of honey.

name: Vespiquen
dexEntry: Commands its subjects to build its hive. It will dispatch any interlopers who dare sneak into its nest and use them as nourishment for itself.

name: Pachirisu
dexEntry: A species related to the Pikachu line. Though Pachirisu is a calm Pokémon, it still presents a danger should one touch its electrified tail or cheeks.

name: Buizel
dexEntry: It moves freely in the water by spinning its forked tail for propulsion. The resemblance to the screw of a steamboat is coincidental.

name: Floatzel
dexEntry: Has a long, rather splendid flotation sac, which prevents Floatzel from drowning even in stormy seas. One might glimpse this species around fishing hamlets from time to time.

name: Cherubi
dexEntry: Once the fruit growing alongside the main body is large and plump, Cherubi will use the nutrients within to evolve. The fruit then detaches, becoming nourishment for other creatures.

name: Cherrim
dexEntry: Motionless, save for the occasional quiver. A rich array of Pokémon can be found gathered around it, drawn by the scent exuded from Cherrim's folded petals.

name: Shellos
dexEntry: Found in abundance on seashores bordering warm waters. Shellos are unexpectedly friendly and will crawl toward any person they see. Take care not to get coated in mucus!

name: Gastrodon
dexEntry: Eats beach sand for nourishment. Should one Gastrodon encounter another of a different color, a fierce battle will inevitably ensue.

name: Ambipom
dexEntry: To affirm their kinship, members of this species will form a ring by linking their newly doubled tails together. On rare occasions, humans have been accepted into such rings.

name: Drifloon
dexEntry: Said to lure away young children and carry them off to the afterlife. Some whisper that Drifloon are formed of reincarnated human souls, but these rumors are as yet unconfirmed.

name: Drifblim
dexEntry: It drifts along at dusk, perfectly silent. Its transient, melancholy aspect touches some people deeply—every so often, one will come upon a song or poem devoted to Drifblim.

name: Buneary
dexEntry: My hypothesis as to why Buneary rolls up its ears is that its hearing is far too keen. I surmise that the Pokémon protects its hearing by limiting the sound that may enter its ears.

name: Lopunny
dexEntry: Its fur is warm and yet remarkably light. This Pokémon kicks as though it were a master of karate, driving back its opponents with ease.

name: Mismagius
dexEntry: The incantations Mismagius chants can ward against misfortune, so a custom exists of inviting it into one's home. Incur the Pokémon's displeasure, however, and disaster will surely ensue.

name: Honchkrow
dexEntry: One cry from this Pokémon, and a murder of Murkrow come flying. At such times, one would think the curtain of night had fallen, plunging the world into jet-black darkness.

name: Glameow
dexEntry: Bewitches humans with its helical tail and piercing gaze. Its hidden claws are quite sharp as well, making this Pokémon an exceedingly tricky opponent if antagonized.

name: Purugly
dexEntry: Though impudent and difficult to tame, Purugly enjoys great popularity due to its fur, the beauty of which surpasses even velveteen.

name: Chingling
dexEntry: This Pokémon gave me an excruciating headache when it seemingly cried out without making a sound. Perhaps there are some sounds that the human ear is simply incapable of hearing.

name: Stunky
dexEntry: The poison that gushes from its aft end is accompanied by an utterly evil-smelling odor with such potency that one whiff can induce memory loss.

name: Skuntank
dexEntry: Sprays a poisonous fluid to take down prey. Sometimes, unable to stomach the stench of its own fluid, it leaves the bested prey uneaten.

name: Bronzor
dexEntry: Floats using a mysterious energy. The pattern engraved upon its back is held as sacred and can sometimes be found in imagery from ancient cemeteries and other such timeworn places.

name: Bronzong
dexEntry: Some believe that its bell-like cry opens holes to another world. It has been revered as a deity since ancient times.

name: Bonsly
dexEntry: Its tears elicit sympathy from those who see them, but do not be deceived! This expulsion of body water is merely a physiological mechanism for keeping itself in good health.

name: Mime-jr
dexEntry: Known to turn up in bustling marketplaces now and again. It mimics people much as a child would, then watches how they react, eyes sparkling.

name: Happiny
dexEntry: In imitation of Chansey, it keeps a round stone tucked into its belly pouch and cherishes it dearly. It gets along well with children and will sometimes play house with them for fun.

name: Chatot
dexEntry: A versatile performer skilled in the imitation of human speech. It is said that older, more experienced Chatot can even understand the meaning of the words they mimic.

name: Spiritomb
dexEntry: It lays curses by thinking wicked thoughts. Writings tell that this Pokémon was born out of the assembly of five score and eight malevolent spirits.

name: Gible
dexEntry: It nests in caves untouched by sunlight. Its sharp teeth may fall out when worn away or after an impact, but they regrow within a few days.

name: Gabite
dexEntry: Though Gabite are usually of a violent disposition, when I gave one a glass bead it had been eyeing covetously, it suddenly became quite docile.

name: Garchomp
dexEntry: Soars across the heavens at blinding speed—a magnificent sight! It has a feral disposition. Utmost caution is required if one meets a Garchomp out in the wilds.

name: Munchlax
dexEntry: Its robust stomach allows it to nonchalantly devour even rotted matter. It pays frequent visits to villages, seeking out food scraps intended for compost.

name: Riolu
dexEntry: Though infantile in appearance, it has the mysterious ability to read the minds of humans. The pure of heart are met with Riolu's approval, while those of ill nature earn only its loathing.

name: Lucario
dexEntry: A most gallant-looking creature. It emits energy waves and controls them with precision, using them to sense even faraway beings. I have given the name ”aura” to this power.

name: Hippopotas
dexEntry: Though large and languid, Hippopotas is difficult to detect due to its tendency to burrow into and lurk beneath the soil. When agitated or excited, it expels sand from its nostrils.

name: Hippowdon
dexEntry: Short-tempered and easily moved to violence. It whips up whirlwinds of sand to crush its foes' spirits, then goes in for the attack.

name: Skorupi
dexEntry: Its claws are not only razor-sharp but poisonous, making Skorupi a highly dangerous Pokémon. It seems to be weakened by cold temperatures, however.

name: Drapion
dexEntry: Has a brutish, ferocious temperament. With immense strength and a sturdy shell off which swords will bounce, it rampages about and wreaks havoc.

name: Croagunk
dexEntry: A poison wielder with a dastardly personality. Despite such qualities, this species is afforded a measure of popularity due to its peculiar cry and comical features.

name: Toxicroak
dexEntry: Its crimson claws contain a virulent toxin. This toxin can be made into a tonic by diluting it, mixing it with several types of wild grass, and boiling it down over two days.

name: Carnivine
dexEntry: Though this is a plant Pokémon, it has a gluttonous and unruly temperament. Carnivine attacks its prey with its cavernous maw wide open.

name: Finneon
dexEntry: What a gorgeous sight this Pokémon is as it swims with its long, pink-painted caudal fins fluttering behind it. Finneon's beautiful appearance has led to its nickname: ”finery fish.”

name: Lumineon
dexEntry: Uses its gleaming fins to hunt its prey. The view of Lumineon schooling near the surface of the sea at night is breathtaking— it's as though there were shining stars right there.

name: Mantyke
dexEntry: Though ball-like in shape, this Pokémon is a proficient swimmer. I have discovered that if a Mantyke spends much time with schools of Remoraid, it will eventually achieve evolution.

name: Snover
dexEntry: One is likely to encounter this Pokémon while out in the snow. There are stories of Snover appearing in human settlements but doing no harm—rather, they bond with the children.

name: Abomasnow
dexEntry: A powerful Pokémon that can split huge boulders with ease. Dislikes associating with others and chooses to live quietly deep within the mountains, playing with the snow.

name: Weavile
dexEntry: This species corners prey as a pack, under the guidance of a leader. Weavile displays increased cunning, leading me to speculate that its evolution caused further brain development.

name: Magnezone
dexEntry: I theorize that a special magnetic field influenced this Pokémon, changing its molecular structure and causing it to evolve. It emits strange radio waves toward space from its antenna.

name: Lickilicky
dexEntry: Its tongue can extend and contract freely, and it is capable of reaching lengths over 10 times Lickilicky's height. Beware of the saliva, as it contains corrosive elements.

name: Rhyperior
dexEntry: This Pokémon evolved through use of a curious item. Its rocklike hide is composed of a mysterious substance and can withstand a blow from a masterwork sword with nary a scratch.

name: Tangrowth
dexEntry: Draped with long vines, it resembles a shrub in appearance. It swings bundles of vines as though they were arms, wrapping them around prey to ensnare them.

name: Electivire
dexEntry: Its evolution was induced by an unusual item, and its electrical output rises along with its heart rate. From its tails, it can unleash an electric current measuring 20,000 volts.

name: Magmortar
dexEntry: Use of a strange item caused this Pokémon to evolve. Fireballs launched from the ends of its tubelike arms are hot enough to melt an iron pot in an instant.

name: Togekiss
dexEntry: Scant few have ever sighted this Pokémon. After studying what literature remains, I am certain Togekiss will reveal itself when peace reigns in the land.

name: Yanmega
dexEntry: Extremely violent. When hunting, it wastes none of its energy, aiming only for prey's most vulnerable spots. Any who manage to tame this Pokémon must be of incredible bravery.

name: Leafeon
dexEntry: Cells similar to those of plants have been found in its fur. Its hard tail can fell a large tree with one stroke, and the tail's sharpness exceeds even that of a sword crafted by a master.

name: Glaceon
dexEntry: Glaceon is able to lower its body temperature very quickly. It freezes the atmosphere, creating diamond dust that glitters like gems while it flutters and dances around.

name: Gliscor
dexEntry: It glides soundlessly on pitch-black wings and sinks sharp fangs into the throat of its prey. It takes on a look of satisfaction once it has entirely drained its prey of blood.

name: Mamoswine
dexEntry: This species reached its zenith during the period known as the ice age. I suspect that Hisui's frigid climate is in harmony with Mamoswine's constitution, thus awakening hidden potential.

name: Porygon-z
dexEntry: A curious item induced this evolution. The Pokémon's offensive capabilities have greatly increased, but the strangeness of its behavior has magnified in equal measure. This worries me.

name: Gallade
dexEntry: The blades extending from its elbows are sharper than the finest swords. Its swordsmanship, albeit self-taught, is astonishingly impressive.

name: Probopass
