dexEntry: It is able to emit powerful magnetism, allowing it control over the iron sand that forms its luscious mustache. Using this iron sand, Probopass forms hard stones with which it smites its prey.

name: Dusknoir
dexEntry: Comes to those whose lives have come to an end and escorts their souls to the afterlife. Known to mistakenly take the souls of those who yet have life left in them, albeit rarely.

name: Froslass
dexEntry: A Pokémon inhabited by the soul of a woman who died bearing a grudge in the snowy mountains. Legends of Froslass placing deathly curses on misbehaving men send shivers down my spine.

name: Rotom
dexEntry: This bizarre Pokémon appears to be a will-o'-the-wisp powered by electricity. Be wary, as Rotom is both smart and mischievous.

name: Uxie
dexEntry: A Pokémon feared but also respected for stealing away the memories of evildoers. I have found records that suggest Uxie holds dominion over knowledge.

name: Mesprit
dexEntry: Known as the Being of Emotion. In legend, this Pokémon was feared, as any who showed disrespect would have their emotions thrown into disarray.

name: Azelf
dexEntry: The dreaded Being of Willpower. Legends tell of this Pokémon manipulating the will of its adversaries and turning them into puppets of its own.

name: Dialga
dexEntry: This Pokémon is revered as a deity in Hisuian legend. The birth of Dialga was what caused the vast river of time to begin flowing in our world.

name: Palkia
dexEntry: This Pokémon is feared as a deity in Hisuian legend. The birth of Palkia was what caused the walls of our world to disappear, creating a sky that spans for infinity.

name: Heatran
dexEntry: Stories tell of this Pokémon being birthed from the boiling magma within Mount Coronet. Its molten-steel body holds many mysteries.

name: Regigigas
dexEntry: According to legend, Regigigas pulled landmasses together and bound them with rope to create the continent of Hisui. Though I have my doubts, the story could well contain a shred of truth.

name: Giratina-altered
dexEntry: There is one Hisuian verse that tells of a powerful light creating a deep shadow. I imagine that this deep shadow is Giratina.

name: Cresselia
dexEntry: Cresselia is reminiscent of the crescent moon. It leaves a brilliant line of light in its wake as it flies across the night sky. I daresay it resembles the heavenly maiden who created the Milky Way.

name: Phione
dexEntry: Can be seen floating offshore during seasons when the seas are warm. Its azure body blends in with the ocean waters—logic suggests this is a defense mechanism against natural predators.

name: Manaphy
dexEntry: Rumored to migrate across the oceans and visit Hisui's coastal waters only rarely. Although Manaphy resembles Phione, it is also quite different. The relation between the two is unclear.

name: Darkrai
dexEntry: On a moonless night, a strange incident occurred in which every one of a village's inhabitants suffered nightmares. The villagers attested that Darkrai appeared before them in these nightmares.

name: Shaymin-land
dexEntry: When the turning of seasons brings the cruel winter to its end and the joyous people give thanks to the heavens, Shaymin appears and covers the withered land with flowers.

name: Arceus
dexEntry: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.

name: Victini
dexEntry: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being’s entire body will be overflowing with power.

name: Snivy
dexEntry: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

name: Servine
dexEntry: When it gets dirty, its leaves can’t be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.

name: Serperior
dexEntry: It can stop its opponents’ movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.

name: Tepig
dexEntry: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.

name: Pignite
dexEntry: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

name: Emboar
dexEntry: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.

name: Oshawott
dexEntry: This Pokémon from the Unova region uses the shell on its belly as a weapon to cut down its foes. Thus, I've conferred upon this shell the name ”scalchop”.

name: Dewott
dexEntry: Its exquisite double-scalchop technique is likely the result of daily training, and it can send even masters of the blade fleeing in defeat.

name: Samurott
dexEntry: Hard of heart and deft of blade, this rare form of Samurott is a product of the Pokémon's evolution in the region of Hisui. Its turbulent blows crash into foes like ceaseless pounding waves.

name: Patrat
dexEntry: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won’t notice a foe coming from behind.

name: Watchog
dexEntry: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.

name: Lillipup
dexEntry: This Pokémon is far brighter than the average child, and Lillipup won’t forget the love it receives or any abuse it suffers.

name: Herdier
dexEntry: The black fur that covers this Pokémon’s body is dense and springy. Even sharp fangs bounce right off.

name: Stoutland
dexEntry: Stoutland is immensely proud of its impressive moustache. It’s said that moustache length is what determines social standing among this species.

name: Purrloin
dexEntry: Opponents that get drawn in by its adorable behavior come away with stinging scratches from its claws and stinging pride from its laughter.

name: Liepard
dexEntry: This stealthy Pokémon sneaks up behind prey without making any sound at all. It competes with Thievul for territory.

name: Pansage
dexEntry: It’s good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It’s kind enough to share them with friends.

name: Simisage
dexEntry: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

name: Pansear
dexEntry: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Simisear
dexEntry: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.

name: Panpour
dexEntry: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

name: Simipour
dexEntry: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.

name: Munna
dexEntry: It eats dreams and releases mist. The mist is pink when it’s eating a good dream, and black when it’s eating a nightmare.

name: Musharna
dexEntry: It drowses and dreams all the time. It’s best to leave it be if it’s just woken up, as it’s a terrible grump when freshly roused from sleep.

name: Pidove
dexEntry: It’s forgetful and not very bright, but many Trainers love it anyway for its friendliness and sincerity.

name: Tranquill
dexEntry: These bright Pokémon have acute memories. Apparently delivery workers often choose them as their partners.

name: Unfezant
dexEntry: This Pokémon is intelligent and intensely proud. People will sit up and take notice if you become the Trainer of one.

name: Blitzle
dexEntry: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

name: Zebstrika
dexEntry: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

name: Roggenrola
dexEntry: When it detects a noise, it starts to move. The energy core inside it makes this Pokémon slightly warm to the touch.

name: Boldore
dexEntry: It relies on sound in order to monitor what’s in its vicinity. When angered, it will attack without ever changing the direction it’s facing.

name: Gigalith
dexEntry: Although its energy blasts can blow away a dump truck, they have a limitation— they can only be fired when the sun is out.

name: Woobat
dexEntry: It emits ultrasonic waves as it flutters about, searching for its prey—bug Pokémon.

name: Swoobat
dexEntry: The auspicious shape of this Pokémon’s nose apparently led some regions to consider Swoobat a symbol of good luck.

name: Drilbur
dexEntry: It’s a digger, using its claws to burrow through the ground. It causes damage to vegetable crops, so many farmers have little love for it.

name: Excadrill
dexEntry: Known as the Drill King, this Pokémon can tunnel through the terrain at speeds of over 90 mph.

name: Audino
dexEntry: This Pokémon has a kind heart. By touching with its feelers, Audino can gauge other creatures’ feelings and physical conditions.

name: Timburr
dexEntry: Timburr that have started carrying logs that are about three times their size are nearly ready to evolve.

name: Gurdurr
dexEntry: Gurdurr excels at demolition—construction is not its forte. In any case, there’s skill in the way this Pokémon wields its metal beam.

name: Conkeldurr
dexEntry: When going all out, this Pokémon throws aside its concrete pillars and leaps at opponents to pummel them with its fists.

name: Tympole
dexEntry: It uses sound waves to communicate with others of its kind. People and other Pokémon species can’t hear its cries of warning.

name: Palpitoad
dexEntry: On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to the ear. Palpitoad with larger lumps on their bodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.

name: Seismitoad
dexEntry: This Pokémon is popular among the elderly, who say the vibrations of its lumps are great for massages.

name: Throh
dexEntry: They train in groups of five. Any member that can’t keep up will discard its belt and leave the group.

name: Sawk
dexEntry: The karate chops of a Sawk that’s trained itself to the limit can cleave the ocean itself.

name: Sewaddle
dexEntry: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.

name: Swadloon
dexEntry: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.

name: Leavanny
dexEntry: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.

name: Venipede
dexEntry: Its fangs are highly venomous. If this Pokémon finds prey it thinks it can eat, it leaps for them without any thought of how things might turn out.

name: Whirlipede
dexEntry: Whirlipede protects itself with a sturdy shell and poisonous spikes while it stores up the energy it’ll need for evolution.

name: Scolipede
dexEntry: Scolipede engage in fierce territorial battles with Centiskorch. At the end of one of these battles, the victor makes a meal of the loser.

name: Cottonee
dexEntry: Weaving together the cotton of both Cottonee and Eldegoss produces exquisite cloth that’s highly prized by many luxury brands.

name: Whimsicott
dexEntry: As long as this Pokémon bathes in sunlight, its cotton keeps growing. If too much cotton fluff builds up, Whimsicott tears it off and scatters it.

name: Petilil
dexEntry: The leaves on its head are highly valued for medicinal purposes. Dry the leaves in the sun, boil them, and then drink the bitter decoction for remarkably effective relief from fatigue.

name: Lilligant
dexEntry: I suspect that its well-developed legs are the result of a life spent on mountains covered in deep snow. The scent it exudes from its flower crown heartens those in proximity.

name: Basculin-red-striped
dexEntry: Though it differs from other Basculin in several respects, including demeanor—this one is gentle—I have categorized it as a regional form given the vast array of shared qualities.

name: Sandile
dexEntry: Sandile is small, but its legs and lower body are powerful. Pushing sand aside as it goes, Sandile moves through the desert as if it’s swimming.

name: Krokorok
dexEntry: Although this Pokémon has specialized eyes that allow it to see in the dark, Krokorok won’t move much at night—the desert gets cold after sunset.

name: Krookodile
dexEntry: While terribly aggressive, Krookodile also has the patience to stay hidden under sand for days, lying in wait for prey.

name: Darumaka
dexEntry: This popular symbol of good fortune will never fall over in its sleep, no matter how it’s pushed or pulled.

name: Darmanitan-standard
dexEntry: This Pokémon’s power level rises along with the temperature of its fire, which can reach 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Maractus
dexEntry: Once each year, this Pokémon scatters its seeds. They’re jam-packed with nutrients, making them a precious food source out in the desert.

name: Dwebble
dexEntry: It first tries to find a rock to live in, but if there are no suitable rocks to be found, Dwebble may move in to the ports of a Hippowdon.

name: Crustle
dexEntry: Its thick claws are its greatest weapons. They’re mighty enough to crack Rhyperior’s carapace.

name: Scraggy
dexEntry: It protects itself with its durable skin. It’s thought that this Pokémon will evolve once its skin has completely stretched out.

name: Scrafty
dexEntry: While mostly known for having the temperament of an aggressive ruffian, this Pokémon takes very good care of its family, friends, and territory.

name: Sigilyph
dexEntry: A discovery was made in the desert where Sigilyph fly. The ruins of what may have been an ancient city were found beneath the sands.

name: Yamask
dexEntry: The spirit of a person from a bygone age became this Pokémon. It rambles through ruins, searching for someone who knows its face.

name: Cofagrigus
dexEntry: There are many depictions of Cofagrigus decorating ancient tombs. They’re symbols of the wealth that kings of bygone eras had.

name: Tirtouga
dexEntry: Tirtouga is considered to be the ancestor of many turtle Pokémon. It was restored to life from a fossil.

name: Carracosta
dexEntry: This Pokémon emerges from the water in search of prey despite the fact that it moves more slowly on land.

name: Archen
dexEntry: Archen is said to be the ancestor of bird Pokémon. It lived in treetops, eating berries and bug Pokémon.

name: Archeops
dexEntry: Though capable of flight, Archeops was apparently better at hunting on the ground.

name: Trubbish
dexEntry: This Pokémon was born from a bag stuffed with trash. Galarian Weezing relish the fumes belched by Trubbish.

name: Garbodor
dexEntry: The toxic liquid it launches from its right arm is so virulent that it can kill a weakened creature instantly.

name: Zorua
dexEntry: A once-departed soul, returned to life in Hisui. Derives power from resentment, which rises as energy atop its head and takes on the forms of foes. In this way, Zorua vents lingering malice.

name: Zoroark
dexEntry: With its disheveled white fur, it looks like an embodiment of death. Heedless of its own safety, Zoroark attacks its nemeses with a bitter energy so intense, it lacerates Zoroark's own body.

name: Minccino
dexEntry: They pet each other with their tails as a form of greeting. Of the two, the one whose tail is fluffier is a bit more boastful.

name: Cinccino
dexEntry: A special oil that seeps through their fur helps them avoid attacks. The oil fetches a high price at market.

name: Gothita
dexEntry: Even when nobody seems to be around, Gothita can still be heard making a muted cry. Many believe it’s speaking to something only it can see.

name: Gothorita
dexEntry: On nights when the stars shine, this Pokémon’s psychic power is at its strongest. It’s unknown just what link Gothorita has to the greater universe.

name: Gothitelle
dexEntry: A criminal who was shown his fate by a Gothitelle went missing that same day and was never seen again.

name: Solosis
dexEntry: Many say that the special liquid covering this Pokémon’s body would allow it to survive in the vacuum of space.

name: Duosion
dexEntry: Its brain has split into two, and the two halves rarely think alike. Its actions are utterly unpredictable.

name: Reuniclus
dexEntry: It’s said that drinking the liquid surrounding Reuniclus grants wisdom. Problem is, the liquid is highly toxic to anything besides Reuniclus itself.

name: Ducklett
dexEntry: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.

name: Swanna
dexEntry: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

name: Vanillite
dexEntry: Supposedly, this Pokémon was born from an icicle. It spews out freezing air at −58 degrees Fahrenheit to make itself more comfortable.

name: Vanillish
dexEntry: It blasts enemies with cold air reaching −148 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing them solid. But it spares their lives afterward—it’s a kind Pokémon.

name: Vanilluxe
dexEntry: People believe this Pokémon formed when two Vanillish stuck together. Its body temperature is roughly 21 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Deerling
dexEntry: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon’s fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

name: Sawsbuck
dexEntry: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.

name: Emolga
dexEntry: This Pokémon absolutely loves sweet berries. Sometimes it stuffs its cheeks full of so much food that it can’t fly properly.

name: Karrablast
dexEntry: It spits a liquid from its mouth to melt through Shelmet’s shell. Karrablast doesn’t eat the shell— it eats only the contents.

name: Escavalier
dexEntry: It charges its enemies, lances at the ready. An image of one of its duels is captured in a famous painting of Escavalier clashing with Sirfetch’d.

name: Foongus
dexEntry: The spores released from this Pokémon’s hands are highly poisonous, but when thoroughly dried, the spores can be used as stomach medicine.

name: Amoonguss
dexEntry: Amoonguss generally doesn’t move much. It tends to stand still near Poké Balls that have been dropped on the ground.

name: Frillish
dexEntry: Legend has it that the residents of a sunken ancient city changed into these Pokémon.

name: Jellicent
dexEntry: Whenever a full moon hangs in the night sky, schools of Jellicent gather near the surface of the sea, waiting for their prey to appear.

name: Alomomola
dexEntry: The reason it helps Pokémon in a weakened condition is that any Pokémon coming after them may also attack Alomomola.

name: Joltik
dexEntry: Joltik latch on to other Pokémon and suck out static electricity. They’re often found sticking to Yamper’s hindquarters.

name: Galvantula
dexEntry: It lays traps of electrified threads near the nests of bird Pokémon, aiming to snare chicks that are not yet good at flying.

name: Ferroseed
dexEntry: Mossy caves are their preferred dwellings. Enzymes contained in mosses help Ferroseed’s spikes grow big and strong.

name: Ferrothorn
dexEntry: Its spikes are harder than steel. This Pokémon crawls across rock walls by stabbing the spikes on its feelers into the stone.

name: Klink
dexEntry: It’s suspected that Klink were the inspiration behind ancient people’s invention of the first gears.

name: Klang
dexEntry: Many companies in the Galar region choose Klang as their logo. This Pokémon is considered the symbol of industrial technology.

name: Klinklang
dexEntry: The three gears that compose this Pokémon spin at high speed. Its new spiked gear isn’t a living creature.

name: Tynamo
dexEntry: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.

name: Eelektrik
dexEntry: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

name: Eelektross
dexEntry: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

name: Elgyem
dexEntry: This Pokémon was discovered about 50 years ago. Its highly developed brain enables it to exert its psychic powers.

name: Beheeyem
dexEntry: Sometimes found drifting above wheat fields, this Pokémon can control the memories of its opponents.

name: Litwick
dexEntry: The younger the life this Pokémon absorbs, the brighter and eerier the flame on its head burns.

name: Lampent
dexEntry: It lurks in cities, pretending to be a lamp. Once it finds someone whose death is near, it will trail quietly after them.

name: Chandelure
dexEntry: In homes illuminated by Chandelure instead of lights, funerals were a constant occurrence— or so it’s said.

name: Axew
dexEntry: They play with each other by knocking their large tusks together. Their tusks break sometimes, but they grow back so quickly that it isn’t a concern.

name: Fraxure
dexEntry: Its skin is as hard as a suit of armor. Fraxure’s favorite strategy is to tackle its opponents, stabbing them with its tusks at the same time.

name: Haxorus
dexEntry: While usually kindhearted, it can be terrifying if angered. Tusks that can slice through steel beams are how Haxorus deals with its adversaries.

name: Cubchoo
dexEntry: It sniffles before performing a move, using its frosty snot to provide an icy element to any move that needs it.

name: Beartic
dexEntry: It swims energetically through frigid seas. When it gets tired, it freezes the seawater with its breath so it can rest on the ice.

name: Cryogonal
dexEntry: When the weather gets hot, these Pokémon turn into water vapor. Cryogonal are almost never seen during summer.

name: Shelmet
dexEntry: It has a strange physiology that responds to electricity. When together with Karrablast, Shelmet evolves for some reason.

name: Accelgor
dexEntry: Discarding its shell made it nimble. To keep itself from dehydrating, it wraps its body in bands of membrane.

name: Stunfisk
dexEntry: For some reason, this Pokémon smiles slightly when it emits a strong electric current from the yellow markings on its body.

name: Mienfoo
dexEntry: Though small, Mienfoo’s temperament is fierce. Any creature that approaches Mienfoo carelessly will be greeted with a flurry of graceful attacks.

name: Mienshao
dexEntry: Delivered at blinding speeds, kicks from this Pokémon can shatter massive boulders into tiny pieces.

name: Druddigon
dexEntry: Druddigon are vicious and cunning. They take up residence in nests dug out by other Pokémon, treating the stolen nests as their own lairs.

name: Golett
dexEntry: This Pokémon was created from clay. It received orders from its master many thousands of years ago, and it still follows those orders to this day.

name: Golurk
dexEntry: There’s a theory that inside Golurk is a perpetual motion machine that produces limitless energy, but this belief hasn’t been proven.

name: Pawniard
dexEntry: A pack of these Pokémon forms to serve a Bisharp boss. Each Pawniard trains diligently, dreaming of one day taking the lead.

name: Bisharp
dexEntry: Violent conflicts erupt between Bisharp and Fraxure over places where sharpening stones can be found.

name: Bouffalant
dexEntry: These Pokémon live in herds of about 20 individuals. Bouffalant that betray the herd will lose the hair on their heads for some reason.

name: Rufflet
dexEntry: Its chick-like looks belie its hotheadedness. It challenges its parents at every opportunity, desperate to prove its strength.

name: Braviary
dexEntry: Screaming a bloodcurdling battle cry, this huge and ferocious bird Pokémon goes out on the hunt. It blasts lakes with shock waves, then scoops up any prey that float to the water's surface.

name: Vullaby
dexEntry: Vullaby grow quickly. Bones that have gotten too small for older Vullaby to wear often get passed down to younger ones in the nest.

name: Mandibuzz
dexEntry: They adorn themselves with bones. There seem to be fashion trends among them, as different bones come into and fall out of popularity.

name: Heatmor
dexEntry: A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the hard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour their insides.

name: Durant
dexEntry: With their large mandibles, these Pokémon can crunch their way through rock. They work together to protect their eggs from Sandaconda.

name: Deino
dexEntry: Because it can’t see, this Pokémon is constantly biting at everything it touches, trying to keep track of its surroundings.

name: Zweilous
dexEntry: Their two heads will fight each other over a single piece of food. Zweilous are covered in scars even without battling others.

name: Hydreigon
dexEntry: The three heads take turns sinking their teeth into the opponent. Their attacks won’t slow until their target goes down.

name: Larvesta
dexEntry: Larvesta’s body is warm all over. It spouts fire from the tips of its horns to intimidate predators and scare prey.

name: Volcarona
dexEntry: This Pokémon emerges from a cocoon formed of raging flames. Ancient murals depict Volcarona as a deity of fire.

name: Cobalion
dexEntry: From the moment it’s born, this Pokémon radiates the air of a leader. Its presence will calm even vicious foes.

name: Terrakion
dexEntry: In Unovan legend, Terrakion battled against humans in an effort to protect other Pokémon.

name: Virizion
dexEntry: It darts around opponents with a flurry of quick movements, slicing them up with its horns.

name: Tornadus-incarnate
dexEntry: This storm-stirring Pokémon is said to cause the seasons to turn by whipping up the air. I suspect its humanlike form to be a false one.

name: Thundurus-incarnate
dexEntry: They say this wielder of electricity has waged war with its nemesis, Tornadus, since time immemorial. The lightning bolts it hurls pierce the very earth and enrich the soil.

name: Reshiram
dexEntry: According to myth, if people ignore truth and let themselves become consumed by greed, Reshiram will arrive to burn their kingdoms down.

name: Zekrom
dexEntry: Mythology tells us that if people lose the righteousness in their hearts, their kingdoms will be razed by Zekrom’s lightning.

name: Landorus-incarnate
dexEntry: When the incarnations of wind and of lightning clash, Landorus arrives to quell the conflict. After the tempests and thunderbolts abate, the land is sure to be blessed with bountiful harvests.

name: Kyurem
dexEntry: It appears that this Pokémon uses its powers over ice to freeze its own body in order to stabilize its cellular structure.

name: Keldeo-ordinary
dexEntry: They say that Keldeo must survive harsh battles and fully develop the horn on its forehead before this Pokémon’s true power will awaken.

name: Meloetta-aria
dexEntry: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.

name: Genesect
dexEntry: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.

name: Chespin
dexEntry: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn’t faze it.

name: Quilladin
dexEntry: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won’t start fights.

name: Chesnaught
dexEntry: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.

name: Fennekin
dexEntry: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

name: Braixen
dexEntry: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.

name: Delphox
dexEntry: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.

name: Froakie
dexEntry: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

name: Frogadier
dexEntry: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute’s time.

name: Greninja
dexEntry: It appears and vanishes with a ninja’s grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.

name: Bunnelby
dexEntry: It’s very sensitive to danger. The sound of Corviknight’s flapping will have Bunnelby digging a hole to hide underground in moments.

name: Diggersby
dexEntry: The fur on its belly retains heat exceptionally well. People used to make heavy winter clothing from fur shed by this Pokémon.

name: Fletchling
dexEntry: When this Pokémon gets excited, its body temperature increases sharply. If you touch a Fletchling with bare hands, you might get burned.

name: Fletchinder
dexEntry: Fletchinder are exceedingly territorial and aggressive. These Pokémon fight among themselves over feeding grounds.

name: Talonflame
dexEntry: Talonflame dives toward prey at speeds of up to 310 mph and assaults them with powerful kicks, giving the prey no chance to escape.

name: Scatterbug
dexEntry: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.

name: Spewpa
dexEntry: The beaks of bird Pokémon can’t begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.

name: Vivillon
dexEntry: The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

name: Litleo
dexEntry: This hot-blooded Pokémon is filled with curiosity. When it gets angry or starts fighting, its short mane gets hot.

name: Pyroar
dexEntry: The temperature of its breath is over 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, but Pyroar doesn’t use it on its prey. This Pokémon prefers to eat raw meat.

name: Flabebe
dexEntry: Flabébé wears a crown made from pollen it’s collected from its flower. The crown has hidden healing properties.

name: Floette
dexEntry: It gives its own power to flowers, pouring its heart into caring for them. Floette never forgives anyone who messes up a flower bed.

name: Florges
dexEntry: Its life can span several hundred years. It’s said to devote its entire life to protecting gardens.

name: Skiddo
dexEntry: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn’t need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.

name: Gogoat
dexEntry: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.

name: Pancham
dexEntry: Wanting to make sure it’s taken seriously, Pancham’s always giving others a glare. But if it’s not focusing, it ends up smiling.

name: Pangoro
dexEntry: Using its leaf, Pangoro can predict the moves of its opponents. It strikes with punches that can turn a dump truck into scrap with just one hit.

name: Furfrou
dexEntry: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

name: Espurr
dexEntry: There’s enough psychic power in Espurr to send a wrestler flying, but because this power can’t be controlled, Espurr finds it troublesome.

name: Meowstic-male
dexEntry: The defensive instinct of the males is strong. It’s when they’re protecting themselves or their partners that they unleash their full power.

name: Honedge
dexEntry: The blue eye on the sword’s handguard is the true body of Honedge. With its old cloth, it drains people’s lives away.

name: Doublade
dexEntry: The two swords employ a strategy of rapidly alternating between offense and defense to bring down their prey.

name: Aegislash-shield
dexEntry: Its potent spectral powers allow it to manipulate others. It once used its powers to force people and Pokémon to build a kingdom to its liking.

name: Spritzee
dexEntry: The scent its body gives off enraptures those who smell it. Noble ladies had no shortage of love for Spritzee.

name: Aromatisse
dexEntry: The scents Aromatisse can produce range from sweet smells that bolster allies to foul smells that sap an opponent’s will to fight.

name: Swirlix
dexEntry: The sweet smell of cotton candy perfumes Swirlix’s fluffy fur. This Pokémon spits out sticky string to tangle up its enemies.

name: Slurpuff
dexEntry: Slurpuff’s fur contains a lot of air, making it soft to the touch and lighter than it looks.

name: Inkay
dexEntry: By exposing foes to the blinking of its luminescent spots, Inkay demoralizes them, and then it seizes the chance to flee.

name: Malamar
dexEntry: It’s said that Malamar’s hypnotic powers played a role in certain history-changing events.

name: Binacle
dexEntry: If the two don’t work well together, both their offense and defense fall apart. Without good teamwork, they won’t survive.

name: Barbaracle
dexEntry: Having an eye on each palm allows it to keep watch in all directions. In a pinch, its limbs start to act on their own to ensure the enemy’s defeat.

name: Skrelp
dexEntry: Skrelp looks like a piece of rotten seaweed, so it can blend in with seaweed drifting on the ocean and avoid being detected by enemies.

name: Dragalge
dexEntry: Dragalge generates dragon energy by sticking the plume on its head out above the ocean’s surface and bathing it in sunlight.

name: Clauncher
dexEntry: By detonating gas that accumulates in its right claw, this Pokémon launches water like a bullet. This is how Clauncher defeats its enemies.

name: Clawitzer
dexEntry: Clawitzer’s right arm is a cannon that launches projectiles made of seawater. Shots from a Clawitzer’s cannon arm can sink a tanker.

name: Helioptile
dexEntry: The sun powers this Pokémon’s electricity generation. Interruption of that process stresses Helioptile to the point of weakness.

name: Heliolisk
dexEntry: One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill outspread is all it would take to produce enough electricity to power a city.

name: Tyrunt
dexEntry: This Pokémon is selfish and likes to be pampered. It can also inflict grievous wounds on its Trainer just by playing around.

name: Tyrantrum
dexEntry: A single bite of Tyrantrum’s massive jaws will demolish a car. This Pokémon was the king of the ancient world.

name: Amaura
dexEntry: Amaura is an ancient Pokémon that has gone extinct. Specimens of this species can sometimes be found frozen in ice.

name: Aurorus
dexEntry: When gripped by rage, Aurorus will emanate freezing air, covering everything around it in ice.

name: Sylveon
dexEntry: It emits a soothing aura from its ribbon-shaped organs. It wraps these appendages around quarrelers to instantly restore calm to the situation.

name: Hawlucha
dexEntry: It always strikes a pose before going for its finishing move. Sometimes opponents take advantage of that time to counterattack.

name: Dedenne
dexEntry: Since Dedenne can’t generate much electricity on its own, it steals electricity from outlets or other electric Pokémon.

name: Carbink
dexEntry: It’s said that somewhere in the world, there’s a mineral vein housing a large pack of slumbering Carbink. It’s also said that this pack has a queen.

name: Goomy
dexEntry: Goomy hides away in the shade of trees, where it's nice and humid. If the slime coating its body dries out, the Pokémon instantly becomes lethargic.

name: Sliggoo
dexEntry: A creature given to melancholy. I suspect its metallic shell developed as a result of the mucus on its skin reacting with the iron in Hisui's water.

name: Goodra
dexEntry: Able to freely control the hardness of its metallic shell. It loathes solitude and is extremely clingy—it will fume and run riot if those dearest to it ever leave its side.

name: Klefki
dexEntry: Klefki sucks in metal ions with the horn topping its head. It seems this Pokémon loves keys so much that its head needed to look like one, too.

name: Phantump
dexEntry: With a voice like a human child’s, it cries out to lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost among the trees.

name: Trevenant
dexEntry: Small roots that extend from the tips of this Pokémon’s feet can tie into the trees of the forest and give Trevenant control over them.

name: Pumpkaboo-average
dexEntry: The light that streams out from the holes in the pumpkin can hypnotize and control the people and Pokémon that see it.

name: Gourgeist-average
dexEntry: In the darkness of a new-moon night, Gourgeist will come knocking. Whoever answers the door will be swept off to the afterlife.

name: Bergmite
dexEntry: Lives on mountains blanketed in perennial snow. It freezes water vapor in the air to make the ice helmet that it dons for defense.

name: Avalugg
dexEntry: The armor of ice covering its lower jaw puts steel to shame and can shatter rocks with ease. This Pokémon barrels along steep mountain paths, cleaving through the deep snow.

name: Noibat
dexEntry: No wavelength of sound is beyond Noibat’s ability to produce. The ultrasonic waves it generates can overcome much larger Pokémon.

name: Noivern
dexEntry: Flying through the darkness, it weakens enemies with ultrasonic waves that could crush stone. Its fangs finish the fight.

name: Xerneas
dexEntry: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.

name: Yveltal
dexEntry: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

name: Zygarde-50
dexEntry: Some say it can change to an even more powerful form when battling those who threaten the ecosystem.

name: Diancie
dexEntry: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.

name: Hoopa
dexEntry: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.

name: Volcanion
dexEntry: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

name: Rowlet
dexEntry: Flies noiselessly on delicate wings. It has mastered the art of deftly launching dagger-sharp feathers from those same wings.

name: Dartrix
dexEntry: Regularly basks in sunlight to gather power—presumably due to the frigid climate. Nonetheless, the edges of the blade quills set into its wings are keen as ever.

name: Decidueye
dexEntry: The air stored inside the rachises of Decidueye's feathers insulates the Pokémon against Hisui's extreme cold. This is firm proof that evolution can be influenced by environment.

name: Litten
dexEntry: Trying to pet Litten before it trusts you will result in a nasty scratch from its sharp claws. Be careful.

name: Torracat
dexEntry: When facing a powerful enemy, Torracat’s fighting spirit gets pumped up, and its fire bell blazes hotter.

name: Incineroar
dexEntry: Incineroar’s rough and aggressive behavior is its most notable trait, but the way it helps out small Pokémon shows that it has a kind side as well.

name: Popplio
dexEntry: If Popplio want to create big, powerful balloons, they must be persistent. It takes daily practice for these Pokémon to develop their skills.

name: Brionne
dexEntry: On nights when the sea is calm, Brionne dance with one another to the singing of the Primarina that’s leading them.

name: Primarina
dexEntry: For Primarina, every battle’s a stage. Its singing and the dancing of its balloons will mesmerize the audience.

name: Pikipek
dexEntry: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!

name: Trumbeak
dexEntry: From its mouth, it fires the seeds of berries it has eaten. The scattered seeds give rise to new plants.

name: Toucannon
dexEntry: Known for forming harmonious couples, this Pokémon is brought to wedding ceremonies as a good luck charm.

name: Yungoos
dexEntry: Although it will eat anything, it prefers fresh living things, so it marches down streets in search of prey.

name: Gumshoos
dexEntry: Patient by nature, this Pokémon loses control of itself and pounces when it spots its favorite meal—Rattata!

name: Grubbin
dexEntry: It uses its big jaws to dig nests into the forest floor, and it loves to feed on sweet tree sap.

name: Charjabug
dexEntry: Its digestive processes convert the leaves it eats into electricity. An electric sac in its belly stores the electricity for later use.

name: Vikavolt
dexEntry: If it carries a Charjabug to use as a spare battery, a flying Vikavolt can rapidly fire high-powered beams of electricity.

name: Crabrawler
dexEntry: Crabrawler has been known to mistake Exeggutor for a coconut tree and climb it. The enraged Exeggutor shakes it off and stomps it.

name: Crabominable
dexEntry: Before it stops to think, it just starts pummeling. There are records of its turning back avalanches with a flurry of punches.

name: Oricorio-baile
dexEntry: This Oricorio has drunk red nectar. If its Trainer gives the wrong order, this passionate Pokémon becomes fiercely angry.

name: Cutiefly
dexEntry: An opponent’s aura can tell Cutiefly what that opponent’s next move will be. Then Cutiefly can glide around the attack and strike back.

name: Ribombee
dexEntry: Ribombee absolutely hate getting wet or rained on. In the cloudy Galar region, they are very seldom seen.

name: Rockruff
dexEntry: This Pokémon intimidates opponents by striking the ground with the rocks on its neck. The moment an opponent flinches, Rockruff attacks.

name: Lycanroc-midday
dexEntry: With swift movements, this Pokémon gradually backs its prey into a corner. Lycanroc’s fangs are always aimed toward opponents’ weak spots.

name: Wishiwashi-solo
dexEntry: When it senses danger, its eyes tear up. The sparkle of its tears signals other Wishiwashi to gather.

name: Mareanie
dexEntry: Unlike their Alolan counterparts, the Mareanie of the Galar region have not yet figured out that the branches of Corsola are delicious.

name: Toxapex
dexEntry: Within the poison sac in its body is a poison so toxic that Pokémon as large as Wailord will still be suffering three days after it first takes effect.

name: Mudbray
dexEntry: It eats dirt to create mud and smears this mud all over its feet, giving them the grip needed to walk on rough terrain without slipping.

name: Mudsdale
dexEntry: Mudsdale has so much stamina that it could carry over 10 tons across the Galar region without rest or sleep.

name: Dewpider
dexEntry: Dewpider normally lives underwater. When it comes onto land in search of food, it takes water with it in the form of a bubble on its head.

name: Araquanid
dexEntry: It acts as a caretaker for Dewpider, putting them inside its bubble and letting them eat any leftover food.

name: Fomantis
dexEntry: During the day, Fomantis basks in sunlight and sleeps peacefully. It wakes and moves around at night.

name: Lurantis
dexEntry: The petals on this Pokémon’s arms are thin and super sharp, and they can fire laser beams if Lurantis gathers light first.

name: Morelull
dexEntry: Morelull live in forests that stay dark even during the day. They scatter flickering spores that put enemies to sleep.

name: Shiinotic
dexEntry: If you see a light deep in a forest at night, don’t go near. Shiinotic will make you fall fast asleep.

name: Salandit
dexEntry: This sneaky Pokémon will slink behind its prey and immobilize it with poisonous gas before the prey even realizes Salandit is there.

name: Salazzle
dexEntry: The winner of competitions between Salazzle is decided by which one has the most male Salandit with it.

name: Stufful
dexEntry: The way it protects itself by flailing its arms may be an adorable sight, but stay well away. This is flailing that can snap thick tree trunks.

name: Bewear
dexEntry: The moves it uses to take down its prey would make a martial artist jealous. It tucks subdued prey under its arms to carry them to its nest.

name: Bounsweet
dexEntry: When under attack, it secretes a sweet and delicious sweat. The scent only calls more enemies to it.

name: Steenee
dexEntry: Any Corvisquire that pecks at this Pokémon will be greeted with a smack from its sepals followed by a sharp kick.

name: Tsareena
dexEntry: A kick from the hardened tips of this Pokémon’s legs leaves a wound in the opponent’s body and soul that will never heal.

name: Comfey
dexEntry: These Pokémon smell very nice. All Comfey wear different flowers, so each of these Pokémon has its own individual scent.

name: Oranguru
dexEntry: It knows the forest inside and out. If it comes across a wounded Pokémon, Oranguru will gather medicinal herbs to treat it.

name: Passimian
dexEntry: Passimian live in groups of about 20, with each member performing an assigned role. Through cooperation, the group survives.

name: Wimpod
dexEntry: Wimpod gather in swarms, constantly on the lookout for danger. They scatter the moment they detect an enemy’s presence.

name: Golisopod
dexEntry: They live in sunken ships or in holes in the seabed. When Golisopod and Grapploct battle, the loser becomes the winner’s meal.

name: Sandygast
dexEntry: Sandygast mainly inhabits beaches. It takes control of anyone who puts their hand into its mouth, forcing them to make its body bigger.

name: Palossand
dexEntry: This Pokémon lives on beaches, but it hates water. Palossand can’t maintain its castle-like shape if it gets drenched by a heavy rain.

name: Pyukumuku
dexEntry: It lives in warm, shallow waters. If it encounters a foe, it will spit out its internal organs as a means to punch them.

name: Type-null
dexEntry: It was modeled after a mighty Pokémon of myth. The mask placed upon it limits its power in order to keep it under control.

name: Silvally
dexEntry: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.

name: Minior-red-meteor
dexEntry: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.

name: Komala
dexEntry: It remains asleep from birth to death as a result of the sedative properties of the leaves that form its diet.

name: Turtonator
dexEntry: Eating sulfur in its volcanic habitat is what causes explosive compounds to develop in its shell. Its droppings are also dangerously explosive.

name: Togedemaru
dexEntry: When it’s in trouble, it curls up into a ball, makes its fur spikes stand on end, and then discharges electricity indiscriminately.

name: Mimikyu-disguised
dexEntry: There was a scientist who peeked under Mimikyu’s old rag in the name of research. The scientist died of a mysterious disease.

name: Bruxish
dexEntry: Its skin is thick enough to fend off Mareanie’s spikes. With its robust teeth, Bruxish crunches up the spikes and eats them.

name: Drampa
dexEntry: Drampa is a kind and friendly Pokémon—up until it’s angered. When that happens, it stirs up a gale and flattens everything around.

name: Dhelmise
dexEntry: After lowering its anchor, it waits for its prey. It catches large Wailord and drains their life-force.

name: Jangmo-o
dexEntry: Jangmo-o strikes its scales to communicate with others of its kind. Its scales are actually fur that’s become as hard as metal.

name: Hakamo-o
dexEntry: Before attacking its enemies, it clashes its scales together and roars. Its sharp claws shred the opposition.

name: Kommo-o
dexEntry: Certain ruins have paintings of ancient warriors wearing armor made of Kommo-o scales.

name: Tapu-koko
dexEntry: The lightning-wielding guardian deity of Melemele, Tapu Koko is brimming with curiosity and appears before people from time to time.

name: Tapu-lele
dexEntry: Although called a guardian deity, Tapu Lele is devoid of guilt about its cruel disposition and can be described as nature incarnate.

name: Tapu-bulu
dexEntry: It makes ringing sounds with its tail to let others know where it is, avoiding unneeded conflicts. This guardian deity of Ula’ula controls plants.

name: Tapu-fini
dexEntry: Although it’s called a guardian deity, terrible calamities sometimes befall those who recklessly approach Tapu Fini.

name: Cosmog
dexEntry: Cosmog is very curious but not very cautious, often placing itself in danger. If things start to look dicey, it teleports away.

name: Cosmoem
dexEntry: It sucks in dust from the air at an astounding rate, frantically building up energy within its core as preparation for evolution.

name: Solgaleo
dexEntry: Solgaleo was once known as the Beast That Devours the Sun. Energy in the form of light radiates boundlessly from it.

name: Lunala
dexEntry: It steals the light from its surroundings and then becomes the full moon, showering its own light across the night sky.

name: Nihilego
dexEntry: It appeared in this world from an Ultra Wormhole. Nihilego appears to be a parasite that lives by feeding on people and Pokémon.

name: Buzzwole
dexEntry: Buzzwole goes around showing off its abnormally swollen muscles. It is one kind of Ultra Beast.

name: Pheromosa
dexEntry: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

name: Xurkitree
dexEntry: They’ve been dubbed Ultra Beasts. Some of them stand unmoving, like trees, with their arms and legs stuck into the ground.

name: Celesteela
dexEntry: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

name: Kartana
dexEntry: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

name: Guzzlord
dexEntry: An unknown life-form called a UB. It may be constantly hungry—it is certainly always devouring something.

name: Necrozma
dexEntry: It needs light to survive, and it goes on a rampage seeking it out. Its laser beams will cut anything to pieces.

name: Magearna
dexEntry: Built roughly 500 years ago by a scientist, the part called the Soul-Heart is the actual life-form.

name: Marshadow
dexEntry: This Pokémon can conceal itself in any shadow, so it went undiscovered for a long time.

name: Poipole
dexEntry: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.

name: Naganadel
dexEntry: One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing, venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid is also immensely adhesive.

name: Stakataka
dexEntry: When stone walls started moving and attacking, the brute’s true identity was this mysterious life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.

name: Blacephalon
dexEntry: A UB that appeared from an Ultra Wormhole, it causes explosions, then takes advantage of opponents’ surprise to rob them of their vitality.

name: Zeraora
dexEntry: Electricity sparks from the pads on its limbs. Wherever Zeraora runs, lightning flashes and thunder echoes.

name: Meltan
dexEntry: They live as a group, but when the time comes, one strong Meltan will absorb all the others and evolve.

name: Melmetal
dexEntry: Centrifugal force is behind the punches of Melmetal’s heavy hex-nut arms. Melmetal is said to deliver the strongest punches of all Pokémon.

name: Grookey
dexEntry: It attacks with rapid beats of its stick. As it strikes with amazing speed, it gets more and more pumped.

name: Thwackey
dexEntry: When it’s drumming out rapid beats in battle, it gets so caught up in the rhythm that it won’t even notice that it’s already knocked out its opponent.

name: Rillaboom
dexEntry: The one with the best drumming techniques becomes the boss of the troop. It has a gentle disposition and values harmony among its group.

name: Scorbunny
dexEntry: It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and one on its nose. Once it’s raring to fight, these pads radiate tremendous heat.

name: Raboot
dexEntry: It kicks berries right off the branches of trees and then juggles them with its feet, practicing its footwork.

name: Cinderace
dexEntry: It’s skilled at both offense and defense, and it gets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts showboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.

name: Sobble
dexEntry: When it gets wet, its skin changes color, and this Pokémon becomes invisible as if it were camouflaged.

name: Drizzile
dexEntry: Highly intelligent but also very lazy, it keeps enemies out of its territory by laying traps everywhere.

name: Inteleon
dexEntry: Its nictitating membranes let it pick out foes’ weak points so it can precisely blast them with water that shoots from its fingertips at Mach 3.

name: Skwovet
dexEntry: It eats berries nonstop—a habit that has made it more resilient than it looks. It’ll show up on farms, searching for yet more berries.

name: Greedent
dexEntry: Common throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon has strong teeth and can chew through the toughest of berry shells.

name: Rookidee
dexEntry: Jumping nimbly about, this small-bodied Pokémon takes advantage of even the slightest opportunity to disorient larger opponents.

name: Corvisquire
dexEntry: The lessons of many harsh battles have taught it how to accurately judge an opponent’s strength.

name: Corviknight
dexEntry: With their great intellect and flying skills, these Pokémon very successfully act as the Galar region’s airborne taxi service.

name: Blipbug
dexEntry: Often found in gardens, this Pokémon has hairs on its body that it uses to assess its surroundings.

name: Dottler
dexEntry: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.

name: Orbeetle
dexEntry: It emits psychic energy to observe and study what’s around it—and what’s around it can include things over six miles away.

name: Nickit
dexEntry: Cunning and cautious, this Pokémon survives by stealing food from others. It erases its tracks with swipes of its tail as it makes off with its plunder.

name: Thievul
dexEntry: With a lithe body and sharp claws, it goes around stealing food and eggs. Boltund is its natural enemy.

name: Gossifleur
dexEntry: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.

name: Eldegoss
dexEntry: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.

name: Wooloo
dexEntry: If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won’t be able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this Pokémon is surprisingly strong.

name: Dubwool
dexEntry: Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the opposite gender. They never see use in battle.

name: Chewtle
dexEntry: It starts off battles by attacking with its rock-hard horn, but as soon as the opponent flinches, this Pokémon bites down and never lets go.

name: Drednaw
dexEntry: This Pokémon rapidly extends its retractable neck to sink its sharp fangs into distant enemies and take them down.

name: Yamper
dexEntry: This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.

name: Boltund
dexEntry: It sends electricity through its legs to boost their strength. Running at top speed, it easily breaks 50 mph.

name: Rolycoly
dexEntry: It can race around like a unicycle, even on rough, rocky terrain. Burning coal sustains it.

name: Carkol
dexEntry: By rapidly rolling its legs, it can travel at over 18 mph. The temperature of the flames it breathes exceeds 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.

name: Coalossal
dexEntry: While it’s engaged in battle, its mountain of coal will burn bright red, sending off sparks that scorch the surrounding area.

name: Applin
dexEntry: As soon as it’s born, it burrows into an apple. Not only does the apple serve as its food source, but the flavor of the fruit determines its evolution.

name: Flapple
dexEntry: It flies on wings of apple skin and spits a powerful acid. It can also change its shape into that of an apple.

name: Appletun
dexEntry: Its body is covered in sweet nectar, and the skin on its back is especially yummy. Children used to have it as a snack.

name: Silicobra
dexEntry: It spews sand from its nostrils. While the enemy is blinded, it burrows into the ground to hide.

name: Sandaconda
dexEntry: Its unique style of coiling allows it to blast sand out of its sand sac more efficiently.

name: Cramorant
dexEntry: This hungry Pokémon swallows Arrokuda whole. Occasionally, it makes a mistake and tries to swallow a Pokémon other than its preferred prey.

name: Arrokuda
dexEntry: After it’s eaten its fill, its movements become extremely sluggish. That’s when Cramorant swallows it up.

name: Barraskewda
dexEntry: It spins its tail fins to propel itself, surging forward at speeds of over 100 knots before ramming prey and spearing into them.

name: Toxel
dexEntry: It manipulates the chemical makeup of its poison to produce electricity. The voltage is weak, but it can cause a tingling paralysis.

name: Toxtricity-amped
dexEntry: This short-tempered and aggressive Pokémon chugs stagnant water to absorb any toxins it might contain.

name: Sizzlipede
dexEntry: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once they’re well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.

name: Centiskorch
dexEntry: While its burning body is already dangerous on its own, this excessively hostile Pokémon also has large and very sharp fangs.

name: Clobbopus
dexEntry: Its tentacles tear off easily, but it isn’t alarmed when that happens—it knows they’ll grow back. It’s about as smart as a three-year-old.

name: Grapploct
dexEntry: Searching for an opponent to test its skills against, it emerges onto land. Once the battle is over, it returns to the sea.

name: Sinistea
dexEntry: The teacup in which this Pokémon makes its home is a famous piece of antique tableware. Many forgeries are in circulation.

name: Polteageist
dexEntry: Leaving leftover black tea unattended is asking for this Pokémon to come along and pour itself into it, turning the tea into a new Polteageist.

name: Hatenna
dexEntry: If this Pokémon senses a strong emotion, it will run away as fast as it can. It prefers areas without people.

name: Hattrem
dexEntry: Using the braids on its head, it pummels foes to get them to quiet down. One blow from those braids would knock out a professional boxer.

name: Hatterene
dexEntry: If you’re too loud around it, you risk being torn apart by the claws on its tentacle. This Pokémon is also known as the Forest Witch.

name: Impidimp
dexEntry: It sneaks into people’s homes, stealing things and feasting on the negative energy of the frustrated occupants.

name: Morgrem
dexEntry: With sly cunning, it tries to lure people into the woods. Some believe it to have the power to make crops grow.

name: Grimmsnarl
dexEntry: Its hairs work like muscle fibers. When its hairs unfurl, they latch on to opponents, ensnaring them as tentacles would.

name: Obstagoon
dexEntry: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.

name: Perrserker
dexEntry: After many battles, it evolved dangerous claws that come together to form daggers when extended.

name: Cursola
dexEntry: Be cautious of the ectoplasmic body surrounding its soul. You’ll become stiff as stone if you touch it.

name: Sirfetchd
dexEntry: After deflecting attacks with its hard leaf shield, it strikes back with its sharp leek stalk. The leek stalk is both weapon and food.

name: Mr-rime
dexEntry: Its amusing movements make it very popular. It releases its psychic power from the pattern on its belly.

name: Runerigus
dexEntry: Never touch its shadowlike body, or you’ll be shown the horrific memories behind the picture carved into it.

name: Milcery
dexEntry: They say that any patisserie visited by Milcery is guaranteed success and good fortune.

name: Alcremie
dexEntry: When Alcremie is content, the cream it secretes from its hands becomes sweeter and richer.

name: Falinks
dexEntry: The six of them work together as one Pokémon. Teamwork is also their battle strategy, and they constantly change their formation as they fight.

name: Pincurchin
dexEntry: It stores electricity in each spine. Even if one gets broken off, it still continues to emit electricity for at least three hours.

name: Snom
dexEntry: It eats snow that piles up on the ground. The more snow it eats, the bigger and more impressive the spikes on its back grow.

name: Frosmoth
dexEntry: It shows no mercy to any who desecrate fields and mountains. It will fly around on its icy wings, causing a blizzard to chase offenders away.

name: Stonjourner
dexEntry: Once a year, on a specific date and at a specific time, they gather out of nowhere and form up in a circle.

name: Eiscue-ice
dexEntry: This Pokémon keeps its heat-sensitive head cool with ice. It fishes for its food, dangling its single hair into the sea to lure in prey.

name: Indeedee-male
dexEntry: Through its horns, it can pick up on the emotions of creatures around it. Positive emotions are the source of its strength.

name: Morpeko-full-belly
dexEntry: It carries electrically roasted seeds with it as if they’re precious treasures. No matter how much it eats, it always gets hungry again in short order.

name: Cufant
dexEntry: If a job requires serious strength, this Pokémon will excel at it. Its copper body tarnishes in the rain, turning a vibrant green color.

name: Copperajah
dexEntry: These Pokémon live in herds. Their trunks have incredible grip strength, strong enough to crush giant rocks into powder.

name: Dracozolt
dexEntry: The powerful muscles in its tail generate its electricity. Compared to its lower body, its upper half is entirely too small.

name: Arctozolt
dexEntry: This Pokémon lived on prehistoric seashores and was able to preserve food with the ice on its body. It went extinct because it moved so slowly.

name: Dracovish
dexEntry: Its mighty legs are capable of running at speeds exceeding 40 mph, but this Pokémon can’t breathe unless it’s underwater.

name: Arctovish
dexEntry: The skin on its face is impervious to attack, but breathing difficulties made this Pokémon go extinct anyway.

name: Duraludon
dexEntry: The special metal that composes its body is very light, so this Pokémon has considerable agility. It lives in caves because it dislikes the rain.

name: Dreepy
dexEntry: If this weak Pokémon is by itself, a mere child could defeat it. But if Dreepy has friends to help it train, it can evolve and become much stronger.

name: Drakloak
dexEntry: Without a Dreepy to place on its head and care for, it gets so uneasy it’ll try to substitute any Pokémon it finds for the missing Dreepy.

name: Dragapult
dexEntry: Apparently the Dreepy inside Dragapult’s horns eagerly look forward to being launched out at Mach speeds.

name: Zacian
dexEntry: This Pokémon has slumbered for many years. Some say it’s Zamazenta’s elder sister—others say the two Pokémon are rivals.

name: Zamazenta
dexEntry: This Pokémon slept for aeons while in the form of a statue. It was asleep for so long, people forgot that it ever existed.

name: Eternatus
dexEntry: It was inside a meteorite that fell 20,000 years ago. There seems to be a connection between this Pokémon and the Dynamax phenomenon.

name: Kubfu
dexEntry: If Kubfu pulls the long white hair on its head, its fighting spirit heightens and power wells up from the depths of its belly.

name: Urshifu-single-strike
dexEntry: Inhabiting the mountains of a distant region, this Pokémon races across sheer cliffs, training its legs and refining its moves.

name: Zarude
dexEntry: Once the vines on Zarude’s body tear off, they become nutrients in the soil. This helps the plants of the forest grow.

name: Regieleki
dexEntry: Its entire body is made up of a single organ that generates electrical energy. Regieleki is capable of creating all Galar’s electricity.

name: Regidrago
dexEntry: Its body is composed of crystallized dragon energy. Regidrago is said to have the powers of every dragon Pokémon.

name: Glastrier
dexEntry: Glastrier has tremendous physical strength, and the mask of ice covering its face is 100 times harder than diamond.

name: Spectrier
dexEntry: As it dashes through the night, Spectrier absorbs the life-force of sleeping creatures. It craves silence and solitude.

name: Calyrex
dexEntry: Calyrex is known in legend as a king that ruled over Galar in ancient times. It has the power to cause hearts to mend and plants to spring forth.

name: Wyrdeer
dexEntry: The black orbs shine with an uncanny light when the Pokémon is erecting invisible barriers. The fur shed from its beard retains heat well and is a highly useful material for winter clothing.

name: Kleavor
dexEntry: A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes and shields itself with hard stone. If one should chance upon this Pokémon in the wilds, one's only recourse is to flee.

name: Ursaluna
dexEntry: I believe it was Hisui's swampy terrain that gave Ursaluna its burly physique and newfound capacity to manipulate peat at will.

name: Basculegion-male
dexEntry: Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui's rivers is Basculegion's equal.

name: Sneasler
dexEntry: Because of Sneasler's virulent poison and daunting physical prowess, no other species could hope to best it on the frozen highlands. Preferring solitude, this species does not form packs.

name: Overqwil
dexEntry: Its lancelike spikes and savage temperament have earned it the nickname ”sea fiend.” It slurps up poison to nourish itself.

name: Enamorus-incarnate
dexEntry: When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokémon's love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.
